title.rendered: No One Else But You, Part 4

content.rendered:
Good morning,

John 6:67, “Then Jesus said to the twelve, “Do you also want to go away?”, vs. 68, “But Simon Peter answered Him, “Lord, to whom shall we go? You have the words of eternal life” It was tough for the disciples to grasp everything Jesus said for Jesus spoke in the spirit while the people tried to analyze it in the natural. With this, the disciples complained. The more you have your foot in the worldly things and the more the flesh is in control, the Spirit will point out things in your life that need to be changed. You may not understand why and may even be offended. God knows how to bring us to a Spiritual level where we appreciate everything He is doing in our lives and through our lives. Though some of them may be tough, but we know that He has a good reason for shaping us that way. Someone asked an individual who makes sculptures how he would make an elephant sculpture off tree trunk. His response was, “Chop what does not look like an elephant off the tree trunk and what you will be left with will be an elephant sculpture”,

We have God chopping off what does not look like Him in our lives that He may be left with a people with His own image. The chopping part is difficult and painful but it is good for us. The disciples had the option to give up on Him but looking at where they had come from, the things they abandoned, the friends they kissed goodbye and how they had managed to make it this far by God’s grace, they could not just see where else to go. I look at my life and I ask myself the same question, where can I go?, I have given up so much to live for Him, the road at times get rough and bumpy and His words are very convicting and I need to change even more to be like Him. There also times I walk in the flesh and what He is saying is not clicking but where can I go?. Peter says, “You have the words of eternal life”. As many as kissed Jesus goodbye, the disciples also had the same chance but they could not.

Lord I refuse to go back even if others are going back. I don’t know what I would do without You in my life, so keep giving me the bread of the life for I need it now more than ever. See it’s not the Lord who wanted to give up on people, it’s the people who wanted to give up on the Lord. He knew their hearts from the beginning and yet He did not leave them, Romans 8:38&39, “For I am persuaded, that neither death, nor life, nor angels, nor principalities, nor powers, nor things present, nor the things to come. Nor height, nor depth, nor any other creature, shall be able to separate us from the love of God, which is in Christ Jesus our Lord”.

Friends, I am fully persuaded that Christ will not give up on us come rain or sunshine and our prayer and desire is that nothing, I mean nothing will separate us from our love for Him. I am determined to keep on walking with Him as tough as it may be, after all I have no where to go, He is my everything. I will look around and I will see many go back but I refuse to go back. With all said and done, “Lord, NO ONE ELSE BUT YOU!!!”. You are my beginning and my end, You are my life, You are my joy and You are my peace, You are my stability and in You will I trust for in my life there is no one else but You!!!!.

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: The Foolishness of God –  Part 5, by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,
30 But of him are ye in Christ Jesus, who of God is made unto us wisdom, and righteousness, and sanctification, and redemption:31 That, according as it is written, He that glories, let him glory in the Lord.? (1 Corinthians 1:30 – 31)

Many hold that the foolishness of God is an oxymoron. Two words that seemingly contradict each other, i.e. jumbo shrimp, honest politician, good devotional 😉 etc. When I read this oxymoron, “foolishness of God,” I thought, “now that is the ultimate oxymoron!” God being foolish — that is impossible! But as you look deeper into this and think through the Bible about all the seemingly foolish ways of God, the term takes on new meaning. Remember in Genesis 6-8 when Noah, built a barge and barge parked in his “driveway” for 120 years, to save 8 people. In Judges 15:16 we read about how Samson kills thousands of Philistines with the jawbone of a donkey. In 1 Samuel 17 we read of the lowly shepherd boy, David, killing the giant Goliath. On and on throughout the Bible, God uses things that are foolish to the world, to shame the wise.

1. We are in Christ “But of him are you in Christ Jesus.” If I put a sponge in a bucket of water, is the water in the sponge or is the sponge in the water? In this scenario both are true. We are in Christ Jesus, because we have confessed and repented of our sins and put our faith in Jesus Christ. If one were about to jump out of a plane, it is not enough to believe in a parachute, one must put it on. We have put on the Lord Jesus Christ and our trust is in Him alone for our salvation.

2. We have wisdom in our lives. “God is made unto us wisdom”, The Scriptures say, “The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom…” To fear our Lord is the starting place of wisdom. How can we really claim to have anything useful as far as knowledge, if we don’t acknowledge the One in whom is life, and truth, the Creator God Himself?

3. We have [His] righteousness, and sanctification, and redemption Ro 3:22 “This righteousness from God comes through faith in Jesus Christ to all who believe. 1Th 5:23 “May God himself, the God of peace, sanctify you through and through…” Ps 111:9 He provided redemption for his people; he ordained his covenant forever—holy and awesome is his name.

?4. We Glorify the Lord “…He that glories, let him glory in the Lord.”? When one realizes that they are in Christ, when one fears God, and has God righteousness, sanctification, and redemption imputed upon him or her, one must acknowledge that all of these things come not from flesh and blood but from God. “This is the word of the LORD unto Zerubbabel, saying Not by might?b?, nor by power, but by my spirit, saith the LORD of hosts.”

The foolishness of God impacts people by impacting people inside with His spirit, so that they will give Him the glory for what He has done, in them, with them, and through them. The clay pot is only worth something because the Potter has formed the lump of clay into something fit for the Potters use. Isaiah said, in 64:8 “Yet, O LORD, you are our Father. We are the clay, you are the potter; we are all the work of your hand.” The Potter gets the glory not the clay. In the foolishness of God, He works through us to receive glory from us. In the foolishness of God when He works in your life, who do you give the glory to? How will you give Him glory today? Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil <><

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: No One Else But You, Part 3

content.rendered:
Good morning,John 6:1-68, “But Simon Peter answered Him, “Lord, to whom shall we go? You have the words of eternal life”

John 6:52, “The Jews therefore quarreled among themselves, saying, “How can this Man give us His flesh to eat?”, by just listening to their reasoning, you can tell that they were living in the flesh and had no spiritual discerning, they were seeing things and understanding things in the natural. As long as we are in the natural, in the carnal stuff, we will behave, argue, think, do things in the flesh but the flesh will not survive for long and I believe that is the reason why Jesus wanted them to have the bread of life that they would operate in the Spirit and not in the flesh. Flesh can and will always deceive, flesh wants it’s own ways but the moment Christ comes in, the flesh has to be crucified. Are you getting upset because you have been convicted about getting out of the flesh and having the bread of life? Christ took care of your needs when you first came to Him but now He is letting you know that there is more to Him than just the natural.

John 6:63, “It is the Spirit who gives life, the flesh profits nothing. The words that I speak to you are Spirit, and they are life”. It’s not God’s only intentions to give us things pertaining to this life, His greatest gift to us is eternal life, eternal things that do not perish. He gives us what will not just keep us in this life but the things that will keep us in eternity. The Sprit of God through Jesus Christ gives us life. We are just in this world for a very short time and as we look around and hear things, we are reminded that the time is very short and Christ could be coming back any minute, are you ready for His coming?

John 6″66, “From that time many of His disciples went back and walked with Him no more”, because the menu changed, many could not stand walking with Him and desiring to be changed completely to follow the Lord. In today’s life, as long as our physically needs are met, many do want to sow even higher with the Lord for they are comfortable where they are. Thank God for the bread of life to keep us moving. We are not dismissing the fact that we need the necessities for our survival but we are not putting emphasis on it as our way of coming to the Lord.

“Lord give me this bread to feed my Sprit everyday, the flesh many times want to take over but help me allow Your spirit to arise that the flesh may be removed. Help me crucify the flesh in order for it to have no say in my destiny “. Don’t leave God because the supply has been cut off, He is giving you the bread of life to teach you many more things that pertains to the kingdom therefore stick in there until the class is over (eternity). Remember I mentioned that, “Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that proceeds from the mouth of God”. Praise God for there is more. One more part to go

Thanks

title.rendered: The foolishness of God – Part 4

content.rendered:
26 For you see your calling, brethren, how that not many wise men after the flesh, not many mighty, not many noble, are called:  27 But God has chosen the foolish things of the world to confound the wise; and God has chosen the weak things of the world to confound the things which are mighty; 28 And base things of the world, and things which are despised, has God chosen, yes, and things which are not, to bring to nought things that are:  29 That no flesh should glory in his presence. (1 Corinthians 1:26 – 29)  

God doesn’t call the qualified, He qualifies the called.I love this truth.  This is an old saying which Evans often reminds many of.  When one reads Hebrews 11 commonly called the Hall of Faith, we read about the biblical giants.  However have you ever wondered how these people became the spiritual giants that we view them as?  I believe that at the time of these people’s lives, they did not consider themselves to be spiritual giants, but rather just ordinary people.   

Imagine with me the following snapshots of the foolishness of God found in the Scriptures. 

Joshua= Go around the wall 7’x’s, and on day 7 march 7x’s and blow your horn.  Does this really sound like wise military advice?  The FOOLISHNESS OF GOD 

David = a small Jewish shepherd boy with one stone and a sling conquers a giant Philistine warrior armed with a sword.  THE FOOLISHNESS OF GOD 

Abraham = I want you to pack up and go out into the desert to a place that I will show you.  Sarah is going to have a baby.  You are no longer to be called Abram, but Abraham because you are going to be the father of many nations.  Go to an unknown destination, have a name change and have a child while pushing 100 years old and a wife pushing 90! THE FOOLISHNESS OF GOD 

Jesus = Jesus himself in John 9, walks up to a blind guy and spits on the ground, makes mud cakes, and shoves it in the guys eyes.  Then he tells him, a blind buy, to go wash in the pool.  How is the blind guy going to get there? The man obeys and received his sight, and still many didn’t believe.   THE FOOLISHNESS OF GOD 

Peter = Throw your net on the right side of the boat, even though you have been fishing all day.  Peter listens to His carpenter Master Jesus, and the disciples had a huge catch in their nets, so much so that they could not pull it in.  THE FOOLISHNESS OF GOD 

Joshua blow your horns.  David fight Goliath.  Abraham Sarah is going to have a baby.  Jesus stick mud in this blind guy’s eyes, so he can see, Peter throw your net on the other side of the boat.  THE FOOLISHNESS OF GOD 

  1. God did not call many wise men after the flesh – (Your name)
  2. God did not call many mighty, not many noble – (Your name)
  3. But God has chose the foolish things of the world to confound the wise – (Your name)
  4. God has chosen the weak things of the world to confound the things which are mighty – (Your name)
  5. God chose the base things of the world, and things which are despised – (Your name)
  6. God has chosen, yes, and things which are not, to bring to nought (nullify) things that are – (Your name)
  7. God’s foolishness results in no flesh (Your name)being able to glory in his presence.

 

Until the nets are filled…
Blessings,

title.rendered: No One Else But You, Part 2

content.rendered:
Good morning,
John 6:1-68, “But Simon Peter answered Him, “Lord, to whom shall we go? You have the words of eternal life”

The reason why serve Christ was covered yesterday and I remember mentioning that it’s good to have the Lord bless us but we should bless the Lord first. To continue from where we left.

John 6:27, “Do not labor for the food which perishes, but for the food which endures to everlasting life, which the Son of Man will give you, because God the Father has set His seal on Him”. From the beginning we see people who come to Jesus following Him because of His teachings but after sometime when they had been fed, they began to look for Jesus not for the Spiritual stuff but for food. He set them straight by letting them know of their agenda. First thing after revealing to them their motive, He tells them not to labor for food (natural) which perishes. During the time of the Children of Israel in the wilderness, the manner was provided for them everyday and it was suppose to be enough just for one day, any food saved went bad. The instruction was to eat enough and wait for a new one the next day but some people decided to save some. What you might really be trying to hold onto on the natural could spoil tomorrow for the natural does not last. Everything that we do and encounter with will come and go but the word of the Lord which is the bread of life will stand forever. Isaiah 40:8, says “The grass withers, the flower fadeth: but the word of our God shall stand forever”. Money will go so are friends, beauty and fame will diminish all that will be left is the Christ, the bread of life. Laboring just for food which is other words just material things will only try and satisfy the physical part but the spiritual part and emotional part are left out but when you have the bread of life, not only will it feed you spiritually, it will cover but both the physical and the emotional. It’s the bread that sustains one through it all, Mathew 4:4, “…Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that proceedeth from the mouth of God”. The word will teach you what faith is all about, being victorious, standing strong, healing, how to live right and it’s through the word that things will in order. Jesus wanted them to move from the little provision they knew about to a greater provision which will help them even in His absence. He wanted them to get the word as that was a sign of wanting to know the Lord. I am not coming because of what I can gain from You Lord, I am coming that I may know You. Listen to Paul’s desire, Philippians 3:10, “That I may know Him, and the power of His resurrection and the fellowship of His suffering, being made conformable unto His death”. Paul longed for more of the eternal bread. Let the Spirit arise and the flesh be removed!!!!

John 6:34&35, “Then they said to Him, “Lord, give us this bread always”, vs. 35, “And Jesus said to them, “I am the bread of life. He who comes to me shall never hunger, and He who believes in me shall never thirst”. Menu change from the natural bread to the eternal (flesh and blood). “You for the natural, I’m giving you the supernatural. Mathew 5:6, “Blessed are they who hunger and thirst for righteousness: for they shall be filled”. Anyone who begins to hunger for the Bread of life is already blessed for the promise of fulfillment is already given. The Samaritan woman kept on coming to the well to get the natural water but when Jesus showed up, He gave her something much more fulfilling than the natural water. Let me clarify, being born again is not having the void in our lives filled, it’s about fleeing the wrath of God having violated His laws through repentance and putting our trust in Christ alone for our eternal salvation, the filling takes place because you belong. John 6:51, “I am the living bread which came down from heaven…; and the bread that I shall give is My flesh, which I shall give for the life of the world”.

title.rendered: No One Else But You, Part 1

content.rendered:
Good morning,

John 6:1-68, “But Simon Peter answered Him, “Lord, to whom shall we go? You have the words of eternal life”

I ask myself the reason why I serve Christ. I am aware of the reason for my existence and that is to worship, walk and work with the Lord and the rest of the things become benefits. Did I come to Christ so as just to escape hell and the wrath to come? or did I come to Christ because of what I could gain from Him? or did I come to Christ because of who He is? I believe that the order of the affection does affect tremendously how we live for Christ. My priority is to lift Him up, John 12:32, “And if I be lifted up from the earth, I will draw all men unto Me”

The book of John starts by telling us about Jesus feeding five thousand. These people had been following Jesus around the Sea of Galilee teaching them, healing those who needed healing and the ones who did not need healing were there to see the signs and wonders being performed. As time went by, it fell on Passover feast of the Jews and Jesus looking up and seeing the people that followed Him, He knew they were hungry for they had walked with Him for a long time without stopping to eat. The multitude was great and there was no food around to feed these people. He speaks with Phillip about getting food for the people but first testing him to see if he would trust in Christ to perform a miracle or look at the circumstance and try and see what could be done in the natural to feed these people. We know that later Jesus used a small boy’s lunch 2 fishes and 5 loaves of bread to feed the five thousand men. The bible does not mention the women and the children which makes me believe there were more than 5 thousand. John 6:11, “And Jesus took the loaves, and when He had given thanks, He distributed them to the disciples…”, Instead of Jesus praying for increase and multiplication, He gives thanks and gives out the little in His hands. We are brooding a generation of complainers and murmurers, people who feel they do not have enough and that could be true but even Jesus who did not have enough gave thanks even with the little. 1Thessalonians 5:17, “pray without ceasing, in everything give thanks for this is the will of God in Christ concerning you”. It’s not only giving thanks FOR it only but giving thanks IN it for it’s God’s will that we give Him thanks in everything.

These people loved the free food for the next day they looked for Jesus again. In the beginning they were interested in knowing what Jesus had to say and after He fed them, they loved the idea of being fed more than what they could hear. We can say that these people had a bad habit but wait a second, hold on tight, we do the same many times, I have come across people who walked with Christ on basis of what He did. It was about what He could do for them and when things went bad, they abandoned their faith. They came on the basis of the promised peace, joy, happiness and provisions. Job went through something like that when the devil told God that the reason Job was serving Him was because of what God had bestowed upon Job. We know of how God allowed the devil to take away everything that Job had to see if Job would give up on God and this is what he said, Job 13:15, “Though He slay me, yet I will trust Him, but I will maintain mine own ways before Him”. Regardless of the situation, he could not give up on God as this was a reminder for Job that he wasn’t following God because of what He could gain from Him but because of who He is. So listen to Jesus response to the people, John 6:26, “…most assuredly, I say to you, you seek Me, not because you saw signs, but because you ate of the loaves and were filled”. Their motives are revealed and now it’s time to divide the wheat and the chaff. Their reaction to Jesus’ word will reveal completely why they came to Christ. Why do you follow Christ? and if you are not, why are you not following Christ? Do you wait until you run into a jam to look to Him cause you know that He is the only one that can help you out?

It’s is good to know that Christ always comes to our rescue according to Psalms 46:1, “God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble” but is that the main reason why we serve Christ? We love to use this word, Lord bless us, how about We Bless the Lord?. Psalm 103:1, “Bless the Lord Oh my soul and all that is within me bless His holy name”, Psalm 34, “I will bless the Lord at all times, His praise shall continually be in my mouth”. Lord I thank you for the blessings that you have bestowed upon me but I pray that it will not be the reason why I serve You. May I serve because of who You are period and let me not confuse the benefits with the Benefactor. No one else but You that I serve!!!

Thanks

title.rendered: Bounce Back

content.rendered:
Good morning,
Daniel 3:17&18, “…our God whom we serve is able to deliver us from the burning fiery furnace, and He will deliver us from your hand, O king. 18, But if not, let it be known to you, O king, that we do not serve your gods, nor will we worship the gold image which you have set up.”

Once in a while in life you will experience disappointments. As I’m put this message together, someone has been disappointed in the last few days. If you’ve never been disappointed, I guess you haven’t hit puberty yet. Disappointed in your job, relationship, boss, children, church, friends. Either you will disappoint someone or they will be disappointed by you, that is a fact of life. Disappointment simply means a feeling of dissatisfaction that results when your expectations are not realized.

Disappointments go hand in hand with shock because it just darned to you that what you had hopes for, worked for, groomed, expected has turned out to be something else. Shock leads to lock in, being extra careful, cautious and not ready to go through the same path again because of what you experienced last time. Often times disappointments leave people disoriented, confused leading them to want to do something they will regret later. It could lead to trying to frustrate the person who has disappointed you so as to get even with them or lead you to stay away. How can one deal with disappointments? I really don’t have a concrete answer but let me share with you how God has taught me to deal with them.

First lets look at three men Shadrach, Meshach, and Abed-Nego. These men were brought from Israel to serve in the land of Babylon but not as slaves. Men required for the job had to be, Daniel 1:4, “young men in whom there was no blemish, but good-looking, gifted in all wisdom, possessing knowledge and quick to understand, who had ability to serve in the king’s palace, and whom they might teach the language and literature of the Chaldeans”. By looking at what was needed, these men had all the qualities. They saw themselves living in the king’s palace, serving in the high ranks and they did until one day a decree was passed that everyone was expected to bow to an idol. I can imagine them being disappointed because what they hoped for has been changed. They came to serve the king but not his gods, they had a God whom they were serving and living for. They had been faithful to the Almighty God, why would they be in a place of disappointment at this time? After a while, it’s explained to them about the furnace heated seven times just for them if they did not bow but this was their response, Daniel 3:16-18, “…, “O Nebuchadnezzar, we have no need to answer you in this matter. 17, If that is the case, our God whom we serve is able to deliver us from the burning fiery furnace, and He will deliver us from your hand, O king. 18, But if not, let it be known to you, O king, that we do not serve your gods, nor will we worship the gold image which you have set up.” Why would they speak this way in this situation?, They had shock absorbers. Unless you have shock absorbers, disappointments will ruin your life. What are shock absorbers? Shock is a violent collision or impact, simply a heavy blow what disappointments are. Absorbers means enduring or accommodating. Cars have absorbers to help steady the impact on the bumps and pot holes it might or will hit. Shock absorbers help level what is already there and that is what the three young men did. I believe they looked at what the Lord had done in their lives. The qualities and the abilities they had that some other young men did not have and that became their shock absorbers. Though disappointed in one area, what had been done could not be compared to what lied a head of them. Because of that, they were able bounce back with a new message, “Our God whom we serve is able…”, their shock absorber was on what God had done and what God could do, “…But if not…”, you can not make a statement like this without having your shock absorbers. These men’s minds were made up, their disappointments could not keep them down. Would you allow your disappointments to keep you down when you have your shock absorbers?

Bounce back, shake it off, get right back on the track, move on, put everything that has happened in the past only carry what can boost you a head. Let it go, let it fade in the dark. If you got to cry, swim through your tears, dry it out and kiss it goodbye because God has given you shock absorbers. Don’t allow your disappointments to dictate what you can be, you can use them to create new appointments. For the three men, their disappointments allowed them to see God in a new dimension cause they created appointments out of them. If you’ve been disappointed, find your shock absorbers and bounce back on the track.

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: Undo What’s Been Done, Part 2

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Genesis 26:15-34, “And Isaac dug again the wells of water which they had dug in the days of Abraham his father”

We began to look at undoing what the enemy has done and that is going back to dig the wells covered. People pray for revival and I believe in revival but the definition people have given revival is not actually what it is. Revival is coming again into activity and prominence. This what Isaac needed to do, revive the wells to be effective, productive, living, flourishing. Are you reviving your wells? God could have told him to dig new ones but the word of God says He is a God of restoration (reviving), bringing back to life that which is dead, Joel 2:25, “So I will restore (revive) to you the years that the swarming locust has eaten, The crawling locust, The consuming locust, And the chewing locust, My great army which I sent among you”

Genesis 26:25, “So he built an altar there and called on the name of the LORD, and he pitched his tent there; and there Isaac’s servants dug a well”. God will not say something He has no answer for. To us it may sound foolish but to Him He knows what He is doing. If you are living by facts, you will not make it with God for long cause many things that God does and asks us to do don’t make sense but they sure work. You go and revive your wells Isaac and I will cause water to flow says the Lord. Revive your altars before Him, revive your prayer life and let Him cause His Living Water to flow. His Water will quench the thirst you always have when nothing else satisfies. Thank God for His promises that never fails. Men may fail but God will never, the bible says that He is not a man that he should lie neither is He the son of man that He should repent, if He said it, surely it will come to pass. Surely means without fail, we may not know the timing but surely we know He will. If He created out of nothing, He will make His water run from the unexpected.

Because Isaac went back and dug the wells, God caused the water to flow and the Philistines saw clearly in vs. 28 that the Lord was with Isaac. They had been hostile to him but after seeing the Lord’s doing, Isaac found favor with them and he also showed them kindness. We still have much to do in our surrounding. To be effective, we have to have our wells with water. Why are you not affecting your department, is it because you have allowed an enemy to fill your wells of joy, peace, favor, confidence, hope with guilt, shame, pride, fear and habits? You have a reason now to undo what’s been done cause you need your well of salvation running. You have a job to do, undo what’s been done.

Thanks

title.rendered: Undo What’s Been Done, Part 1

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Genesis 26:15-34, “And Isaac dug again the wells of water which they had dug in the days of Abraham his father”

Wells are dug down deep with an aim to get water. Human survival depends on water. God has referred Himself as the Living Water that quenches the thirst of men. The Samaritan woman in the John 4 came to the well to draw water and right at the well, she meets Jesus who asks for water then later claims that He has water that can make her thirst no more. She desired this water, do we?

That sounds so good but here is the problem. Abraham had dug wells, at a later time, the philistines (enemies) came and filled them with earth (soil). They covered them up and water would not flow anymore. Genesis 26:15 “Now the Philistines had stopped up all the wells which his father’s servants had dug in the days of Abraham his father, and they had filled them with earth”. Do you realize that you have an enemy constantly trying to fill your wells with dirt? You lost your effectiveness because water is not flowing in your well, the enemy covered it up. You have become rigid, dry and gasping for breath. The desert scotching sun has left you weary to a point of giving up. You wonder what happened to the healing, restoration and deliverance promised by God to His children. And the most important thing, you have lost connection with God. The explanation is simple, “you well is covered up”. Don’t expect new wells to be dug, you got to go back the old wells and dig them up. Running from place to place is not the answer, self-pity will not work, you have a job to do, rise up and go to work.

Genesis 26:18, “And Isaac dug again the wells of water which they had dug in the days of Abraham his father”. Your survival depends on whether you have water running. Dig your wells again, you need that first love, that fire to serve Christ, the passion to witness, desire for greater things in line with His will cause they are in that well covered up. You encounter with the living water, you will not thirst again. No one will do it for you, you have to take a stand and say, “I will dig my wells again”. “I can’t go on living a defeated life because I allowed the enemy to fill my wells”. The enemy knows that is where my life is and that is why he filled them up. Isaiah 12:3, “Therefore with joy you will draw water from the wells of salvation”. Don’t you know that right where you are you have a well of salvation that has more to offer than just salvation? Psalm 103:2, “Bless the Lord oh my soul and forget not HIS BENEFITS”. Wells of salvation has benefits, dig them again, undo what’s been done. will finish. Blessings Ev

title.rendered: He is in the Boat

content.rendered:
Good morning,Romans 15:13, “… may the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, …”

I think that feelings are good and can be bad some times. If we based our salvation on feeling then we are in trouble. If we are to feel God to know He is present then we still lack understanding that God is ever present. The one thing I hear many say when they are in trying times is “how come I don’t feel God in my situation”. This is the whole reason why we can live a defeated life if our whole experience is based on whether I feel God present or not and if He is, why is He silent in my situation.

In Mark 39:35 onwards, One evening Jesus tells the disciples to cross with him to the other side. He had been teaching the multitudes. I believe in the teaching, there were a lot of things to learn and “faith” could have been one of them. The bible says, “Faith comes by hearing, and hearing by the word of God”, faith learnt in class room yet to be mastered in the sea of life. Some of the teachings were not new to them for they listened to the Master teach many times. To cross to the other side required a means of boat to make it. And the bible says, in verse 37 that a great windstorm arose, and the waves beat into the boat, so that it was already filling. 38 But He was in the stern, asleep on a pillow. In their sailing, they faced a situation that challenged their faith. Everything was okay when they left, Jesus was present with them but when the situation a rose, Jesus was no where to be found because he was at the bottom of the boat peacefully sleeping. Imagine the boat beginning to fill with water as the bible mentions it, who would have been affected by the water first? Jesus. While in this tough situation, the tried to steady the boat on their own, they were getting hysterical. One thing they were lacking was PEACE and because they lacked PEACE, they could not have JOY.

Here is my point to all these, Romans 15:13, “… may the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in BELIEVING. Mark that it’s not saying to be filled with joy and peace in FEELING. There are times feelings will fail you. Through His teachings, Jesus was filling them with hope that it might produce peace and joy in every tough time they would face in life and this might have been a little test to see if they could put into practice what they learnt. The disciples should have been filled with peace and joy in believing that the presence of Jesus on the boat was enough to make them sail through the windstorm. Just knowing that even if He was a sleep, even if they could not feel his presence in the middle of the windstorm, knowing that He was somewhere within the boat was enough to produce peace and joy.

You might say, “how would that happen?”, well if Jesus was in this boat that was being rocked by the wind, water coming inside and He was peaceful, don’t you think that should have filled them with peace and joy? And if that was not enough to give them peace and joy, think about it, do you think that Jesus who is 100% God could have drowned??. What about you in your boat sailing in this sea of life, facing windstorm, you are loosing your peace and joy because you might have based everything on feelings which go with happiness. Don’t you believe that God of hope can fill you with His peace and joy in believing that He is ever present in your boat? That as long as He lives inside of you you cannot drown because He can’t drown? 1 John 4:4, says, ” You are of God, little children, and have overcome them, because He who is in you is greater than he who is in the world. This verse alone gives me peace and joy knowing that He is greater in me than the challenge before me. I can ride through the storm believing that He is present. If I don’t feel Him, that is still ok for I know He did not leave me. I can smile in the midst of the storm because His peace surpasses all understanding and his joy is unspeakable in me. I can make it not because everything is in place but because 2 Timothy 1:12 …I know whom I have believed and am persuaded that He is able to keep what I have committed to Him until that Day”. My heart, peace, be still, He is in the boat!!

content.rendered:
Good morning,23 But we preach Christ crucified, to the Jews a stumbling block, and to the Greeks foolishness; 24 But to them which are called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ the power of God, and the wisdom of God. (1 Cor.1:23)

Let me ask you a question.How many hairs are on the back of a fully grown Tibetan yak? How many pieces of sand are on the combined islands of Hawaii?How many times did you turn over last night when you slept?There are many things that we don’t know.If we don’t know so many things as Christians, how much more do the unsaved struggle with all the questions about the things of God that they can’t figure out with their intellect nor with state of the art technology?When Christ came on the scene it really baffled the Jews and the Greeks (Gentiles).Paul said that Christ’s crucifixion was a stumbling block to them.Why?Peter explains, “Wherefore also it is contained in the scripture, Behold, I lay in Zion a chief corner stone, elect, precious: and he that believes on him shall not be confounded.7 To you therefore which believe he is precious: but to them which be disobedient, the stone which the builders disallowed (rejected), the same is made the head of the corner, 8 And a stone of stumbling, and a rock of offence, even to them which stumble at the word, being disobedient: whereunto also they were appointed.”Christ “came to his own, and his own received him not (John 1:11).”The Jews were the builders that rejected the most important piece of building material (namely the cornerstone) Jesus Christ.They had the most important piece for the construction of the building; however instead of recognizing Christ, instead they foolishly tripped over the very piece they so desperately needed.David wrote, “Unless the LORD builds the house, its builders labor in vain (Psalm 127:1).”The Jews were building in vain by failing to allow the Lord Jesus to be the chief cornerstone, the very foundation of the house.

In the foolishness of God, God sent the very answer the Jews had been awaited, Jesus the Messiah, but they overlooked Him instead of having their blind eyes open and believe Him.The message we preach, Christ crucified, is still a stumbling block for the Jews.Let us use their stumbling stone as our stepping stone, to bring them the truth they heavily reject.The reason that people need Jesus is because they are disobedient toward God, showing their sin nature through the breaking of His Moral Law (The Ten Commandments).

1. The Stone (Jesus) was rejected. 2. Jesus is the Cornerstone. 3. Many stumble at His Word to repentant and put their faith in Him. 4. Those stumbling are the disobedient people in the world. 5. Jesus is the rock of offense; he goes against the flow of the word and tradition of man. 6. Unless the Lord builds the house it will not last.

Preach the Word in season and out fo season no matter who may be offended, no matter who may stumble.He is the cornerstone of the lives of His children so let us not be ashamed to preach His Word.

Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil <<

title.rendered: The Foolishness of God

content.rendered:
Good morning,

20 Where is the wise? where is the scribe? where is the disputer of this world? Has not God made foolish the wisdom of this world? 21 For after that in the wisdom of God the world by wisdom knew not God, it pleased God by the foolishness of preaching to save them that believe. 22 For the Jews require a sign, and the Greeks seek after wisdom: (1 Cor.1:20-22)

With all the wisdom the Greeks & Egyptians had, with all the wisdom of all the cultures of all mankind in its totality. In the wisdom of God they NEVER found God. The late Dr. Walter Martin said, “The golden ages of Greece lead the Greeks to Plato’s philosophy, utter disaster, moral chaos, and multiple-polytheistic worship. They came up with a god for everything under the sun and one for the sun itself. Zeus, Athena, Aphrodite, were the gods they conceived yet they each had human characteristics, including sin, and could overcome and be overcome by humanity.” The totality of mans wise efforts to find God, ended up in divine bankruptcy. And to rephrase Paul’s sarcastic words towards the ungodly, “In the wisdom of God the world by wisdom couldn’t get itself arrested.” It couldn’t find out anything about God.

I love the dialog in Matthew 16, where Jesus asks His twelve, “But who do you say that I am? 16 And Simon Peter answered and said, ‘You are the Christ, the Son of the living God’. 17 And Jesus answered and said to him, ‘Blessed are you, Simon Barjona: for flesh and blood has not revealed it to you, but my Father which is in heaven'”. Although it is logical and completely reasonable to believe in God, the revelation of God does not come through flesh and blood, not through the wisdom of this world. What is the difference between the wisdom of this world and the wisdom of God? Perhaps the following illustration will shed light on this subject.

The Sinking Ship (Taken from the Evidence Bible) Imagine for a moment that you are standing on the seashore gazing at a large ocean liner. The sun is shining. There is no wind and the sea is calm. To your amazement, about thirty people suddenly dive off the end of the ship and cling to a lifeboat. You shake your head in disbelief at their foolishness. Then without warning, the great ocean liner strikes an iceberg and suddenly sinks, taking all on board with it. Those who looked like fools in abandoning the ship were actually wise, and those who seemed wise by staying on board were, in truth, fools. The world scoffs at those who abandon the ship of this world and cling to the lifeboat of the Savior. But Christians know that this great pleasure-cruiser will eventually come into contact with the immovable iceberg of the Law of God, sink into hell . . . and take all those on board with it.

1. God makes foolish the wisdom of this world. 2. The world’s wisdom does not lead to God. 3. God is pleased when His “foolish” Gospel is preached toward those that believe. 4. Some seek a sign but yet cannot see the “sign” of the Cross. 5. Some seek worldly wisdom to try to know God, but it doe not lead to Him. 6. Knowing God comes through a Divine revelation.

God has given His wisdom to His children. He desires His children to appropriate that wisdom to serve Him with one’s whole heart, mind, soul, and strength. God’s wisdom is acquired through conforming to His will. What will you do to walk in His wisdom today?

Until the nets are filled…
Blessings,
Pastor Phil <><

title.rendered: Why We Serve Christ

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1Peter 3:15, “But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts, and always be ready to give a defense (reason) to everyone who asks you a reason for the hope that is in you, with meekness and fear”

We appreciate messages on life enhancements, steps to happiness, how to live a successful life, how to prosper and the like. These messages are good and we should love them but the messages on holiness, righteousness, purity, sanctification, concentration, servant hood should have a greater impact in a life of a believer. The Benefactor is more to me than benefits!!!!

If you apply for a job in a company, the main thing is not the benefits but the job itself.  As you discuss the nature of the job, the requirements, the salary, the environment, the expectations somewhere in between you will discuss the benefits. I don’t think that anyone applies for a job primarily for benefits. With this in mind, the first question I ask myself, why I’m I serving Christ? Why did I come to Christ?. I believe that our understanding about why we serve Christ helps eliminates many things that we get frustrated about for we have a clear understanding of why we chose or Christ chose us in the first place. Did I come to serve because He promised me life enhancement, happiness, comfort? Why are you serving Christ?

I came to Christ primarily because He offered me the gift of eternal life in order to escape the wrath to come. The bible says in Hebrews 9:27, “And as it is appointed unto men once to die, but after this is judgment” and His judgment will not be based on the life enhancement, it will be based on whether I repented, my sins forgiven and received eternal life. If coming to Christ is to receive the gift of eternal life, then serving Christ is to maintain the gift and letting more people know how they too can receive it. If someone shared with you and pointed you to Christ, you should be compelled to do the same.

Serving Christ does have benefits too, Psalm 103:1-4, “…, Bless the Lord, O my soul and forget not His benefits, Who forgives all your iniquities, who heals all your diseases, who redeem your life from destruction, who crowns you with loving kindness and tender mercies, who satisfies your mouth with goods things etc”. So should I give up on Christ because some of these benefits are not provided? no, because my coming to Him was to receive the gift of eternal life. We need to put the emphasis on the hope to come and not on the benefits.

Serving Christ is not about happiness but righteousness. We who have received Christ have eternal life, a life beyond the grave. Romans 14:17, “For the kingdom of God is not meat and drink, but righteousness, and peace, and joy in the Holy Ghost”. Meat and drink always goes with happiness but for us believers it’s more than that, it’s righteousness, holiness, purity, joy, unspeakable joy in the Holy Ghost. Happiness depends on the circumstance, joy depends on the promise that regardless of what happens, I have the joy of knowing that one day when this life is over I will be in heaven.

1Peter 3:15, “But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts, and always be ready to give a defense (reason) to everyone who asks you a reason for the hope that is in you, with meekness and fear”. Sanctify is to set apart for sacred use, it’s also to make holy and purify. The definition I love, sanctify is to make productive of holiness. The Lord is holy and because He lives inside of us, we have to set ourselves apart in readiness for His use, we have to desire holiness and purity. Our uniqueness will raise questions and what a joy to stand and respond confidently the reason why we serve Christ. Christ in us the hope of glory, surely someone will ask you about Him, are you ready to give an answer? If asked, we will answer with meekness (submissive, patient, humbleness) and fear (extreme reverence). Don’t know about you, but I want to be different in the sight of men and when they ask me what makes me different, I will not be afraid and intimidated to speak about thehope that is in me. This will also remind me more about why I serve Christ.

Thanks

title.rendered: Fighting Scared

content.rendered:
Good morning,

2Timothy 1:7, “For God has not given us a spirit of fear, but of power and of love and of a sound mind”

Fear is one of the greatest battles I face everyday and I constantly fight it for I know it’s not of God. Fear can be scary, horrific, dreading, frightening, alarming and even worrying.

Are you battling some fear in your life? Fear of tomorrow, life, rejection, failing, nightmares and many more. Many fear to share what they have learnt, inspiration, encouragement for they feel that it will rob them of what they already have. Fear of thinking that someone will be better than you when you share with them what you have. There is a fear of going to greater levels for there is a feeling of incompetence, fear to marry and who to marry and not feel like a mistake is made, fear of flying for what has happened in the past, fear of getting into ministry for you do not feel qualified. We have all kinds of fears circulating in our lives. Let’s look at one man who had so many fears to deal with.

Judges 6:11, “…Gideon threshed wheat in the winepress, in order to hide from the midianites”. Gideon is hiding because he is afraid of the enemy, we have our own enemies who inflict fears in our lives but the bible says, Psalm 23:4, “Yeah, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil; For You are with me”. The enemy is always out to kill, steal and destroy but we have a covering and assurance that no matter what we deal with, we will not fear evil for God is with us.

Judges 6:23, “Then the Lord said to him, “peace be with you; do not fear, you shall not die”, Here we see how Gideon has encountered with the Lord and he is afraid for we saw this many times when people encountered with God in the old testament, there would be such a fear for it was not always something possible unless you were chosen by God to reach out to His people through what He had to say. Judges 6:27, “…But because he feared his father’s household and the men of the city too much to do it by day, he did it by night”. As the Lord was directing Gideon and Gideon was beginning to know the Lord he had never known, he offers a sacrifice to the Lord which was good and the Lord gave him another instruction to tear down the altar of Baal which was the idol Gideon’s people worshipped. Because of the fear in his life, he does it but he does it at night and by morning all the idols are destroyed.

Judges 6:36, “So Gideon said to God, “If You will save Israel by my hands as You have said”, vs. 37, “look, I shall put a fleece of wool on the threshing floor; if there is a dew on the fleece only, and it’s dry on all the ground then I shall know that You will save Israel by my hand, as You have said”. Once again we see Gideon with another fear and that is the fear to trust. He has encountered with the Lord and so far everything looks good until the Lord tells him that he is chosen him to save Israel. For him to trust and believe, he asks the Lord to perform certain miracles and to my amazement, the Lord is patient with him and does as he has requested. I believe that as the Lord prepares us to be instruments, yes we might have fear but He will be patient enough with us to work with us and reveal to us what He can do that our total trust may strangle the fear inside of us.

Judges 7:2, “And the Lord said to Gideon, “The people who are with you are too many…, vs. 3. “Now therefore proclaim in the hearing of the people saying, “whoever is fearful and afraid, let him turn and depart at once from a Mount Gilead”. And 22,000 of the people returned”. The Lord has a sense of humor for He is telling Gideon that the people he has are too many to fight the battle hence not taking glory from God and then He tells him to release all the people who are fearful and afraid. Remember that the leader is fearful and afraid and should be the first one to leave but he is not for the Lord is already dealing with his fear as time goes by. Through this, the Lord is building him up not to put his confidence and trust in man.

Judges 7:9, “It happened on the same night that the Lord said to him, “Arise, go down against the camp, for I have delivered it into you hand, vs. 10, “But if you are afraid to go down, go down to the camp…” vs. 11, “And you will hear what they say; and afterward your hands shall be strengthened to go down against the camp”. I thought the Lord finished dealing with his fears. Gideon is still afraid but he is sticking with God, He is fighting scared and he keeps on moving, one last thing before his strike helps him see that what is fearful about is actually nothing for the Lord sends him to the camp and if you read the portion of the scripture you will find that in as much as Gideon was fearful of the enemy, the enemy was more fearful than him and his people. It is very possible that what we are really fearful about is actually afraid of us meaning that it can be conquered

We have a chance to fight scared, someone said that, “Courage is not the absence of fear, it’s the force that concurs it”. I want to overcome fear for God has not given me a spirit of fear but of power and of love and of sound mind that I may be aware of the enemy’s plans. I don’t want to leave and go back like the 22,000 who left but I want to move forward even if I am fighting scared so Lord help me!!

Thanks,
Evans

title.rendered: Foolish Preaching, part 2 by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

19 For it is written, I will destroy the wisdom of the wise, and will bring to nothing the understanding of the prudent.

“Imagine for a moment that you are standing on the seashore gazing at a large ocean liner. The sun is shining.  There is no wind and the sea is calm. To your amazement, about thirty people suddenly dive off the end of the ship and cling to a lifeboat. You shake your head in disbelief at their foolishness. Then without warning, the great ocean liner strikes an iceberg and suddenly sinks, taking all on board with it.  Those who looked like fools in abandoning the ship were actually wise, and those who seemed wise by staying on board were, in truth, fools.  The world scoffs at those who abandon the ship of this world and cling to the lifeboat of the Savior. But Christians know that this great pleasure-cruiser will eventually come into contact with the immovable iceberg of the Law of God, sink into hell … and take all those on board with it (The Evidence Bible).”

Recently we examined the verse, “For the preaching of the cross is to them that perish foolishness; but to us which are saved it is the power of God.

Now Paul introduces a quote from the Prophet Isaiah (29:14), “Therefore once more I will astound these people with wonder upon wonder; the wisdom of the wise will perish, the intelligence of the intelligent will vanish.”  Paul is showing that God dismisses the wisdom of men as a means of salvation.  These people were giving God lip – service but their hearts were not converted.  In verse thirteen Isaiah says, “The Lord says: “These people come near to me with their mouth and honor me with their lips, but their hearts are far from me.  Their worship of me is made up only of rules taught by men.  Man-made precepts and mouthing of words for salvation (Isa 29:13) will not move the heart of God.  He will set aside man’s wisdom and understanding as a means of finding favor with him.  God makes two promises that Paul has written:

First, I will destroy the wisdom of the wise.  Humanity cannot strive for salvation through their wisdom.  If humanity thinks for a moment that God can be swayed by the wisdom of man, God will destroy that wisdom, and show it to really be the foolishness of humanity.  In Matthew 16, Jesus is speaking with His twelve and asks, “Who do you say that I am?”  Peters answers Him saying, “You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.”   Jesus responds to Peter saying, “Blessed are you, Simon son of Jonah, for this was not revealed to you by man, but by my Father in heaven.”  It was not man’s wisdom that lead Peter to this knowledge, but rather revelation from the Lord.  David the Sheperd slayed Goliath the Warrior, as God destroyed the wisdom of man.

Secondly, [I] will bring to nothing the understanding of the prudent.  God has a way of crushing the understanding of the prudent.  Jesus confounded the Jews, He was the Messiah that most of them missed, and they couldn’t understand who Jesus really was!  Now most of the Jews follow the word of man, instead of the Word of God.  God calls us to preach His Word, which may be foolish to many, but God uses His Word that we preach to bring to nothing the understanding of the prudent.   Romans 3:19 reads, “Now we know that whatever the law says, it says to those who are under the law, so that every mouth may be silenced and the whole world held accountable to God.”  There is no escape, no matter how intellectual someone may think they are, not submitting to the Lord is complete foolishness.  How is your submission factor?  Are you preaching His Word, despite the fact you may look foolish to the world?

Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil

title.rendered: Foolish Preaching, By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

My apologies for not sending devotions yesterday. I am offsite training for the whole week so I might have devotions tomorrow unless someone is touched to share then I will send it out to the team on your behalf. Be blessed as Pastor Phil shares. Ev

“﻿For the preaching of the cross is to them that perish foolishness; but unto us which are saved it is the power of God.﻿” (1 Corinthians 1:18)

In the landscape of religion and politics the art of preaching is a key component used to persuade people.  When the cross of Christ is preached however, it is not preached to promote religion or politics, but true relationship with the Prince of Truth.  However, when those that are perishing hear the cross preached, they respond to it as foolishness.  Josh McDowell wrote, “It seems to me that either the resurrection of Jesus Christ is one of the most wicked, vicious, heartless hoaxes ever foisted upon the minds of men, or it is the most fantastic fact of history.”

There are only two choices when it comes to looking at the cross.  Either Christ was foolish for His willing submission to the cross, or those that refused to believe (those that were perishing) were foolish.  Christ rose on the third day and defeated death hell and the grave.  Jesus did what he said He would do, rise from the dead.  Therefore those that are perishing, living in rebellion toward God and therefore sit under condemnation are foolish, because Christ is their only way out.  The Christ upon the cross is the only ransom (payment) for their sins, and without Him one remains in their sins.  One will live and die standing before God upon one’s own righteousness which will not persuade the Judge, or one will stand upon the righteousness of Christ, having trusted in the cross.  When one trusts in the cross to them the cross is the power of God.  The transference of standing upon our righteousness switches to standing upon Christ’s righteousness, which is perfect, holy, and just, in the sight of a holy God.  The issue remains in God’s sight as righteousness, not happiness.

The preaching of the cross is foolishness….  Are you preaching the cross?  Are you sharing the truth about Jesus Christ?  Many will hear your words as intolerant upon hearing that Jesus Christ is the only way to heaven.  Are they not being intolerant by calling you intolerant?  Either way God does not tolerate sin and rebellion.

“…to them that are perishing…”  God’s will is for none to perish but for all to come to repentance.  People are perishing; do you as a Christian care about this fact?  What are you doing about it.  Paul wrote that is was not Bible study, prayer, Sunday morning church service, etc…, but the preaching the cross that God implores.

“For us which are saved it is the power of God.”  Paul wrote I am not ashamed of the gospel because it is the power of God unto salvation for everyone who belives, to the Jew first and also to the Greek (Gentile).  If you have the power of God because of your salvation, then use that power unashamedly to bring the message of salvation and plant it in the heart of one that is ready for God’s truth!

When we forsake our duty, our mandate, then perhaps we are being even more foolish then the perishing, because we are being knowingly disobedient to the God we profess to love and follow. Go and reach the perishing today.

Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil <<

title.rendered: Receiving Your Desires Part 1, By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,
“Trust in the LORD, and do good; so shall you dwell in the land, and verily you shall be fed.”

We all want certain things in life. What are the things you dream most of obtaining in this life? Are your dreams material things or immaterial things? Do they fulfill a need or greed in your life? Are they only about yourself, or are your desires centered on providing for or helping others? Is your dreams family oriented and godly centered?

David tells us in Psalm 37:3 that one of the first steps to receiving your desires is to “Trust in the Lord and do good.” The Trust Factor is something everyone exhibits on a daily basis. There are surely those that are less trusting, but I don’t believe that there are any that are non – trusting. Are you sitting down as you read this devotion? If so then you are trusting in a chair to hold your weight up. Did you drink coffee, tea, orange juice or some other beverage this morning? If so then you trusted that those who made your beverage didn’t poison it. Thank God! To trust God is like sitting in a chair, believing that the chair manufacturer made the chair with a promise to hold you up as you sit it. The Promises of my Life’s Manufacturer, the Lord Himself, are 100% true. Now I have seen people sit on chairs and the chairs have broken in the process. However, I have never seen any one of my Heavenly Fathers Promises broken. Why, because He who promised is true. How is your trust level, do you trust God?

Secondly, David tells us “do good.” Doing good are doing those things that please the God you trust in. We shouldn’t trust pray for a job, but need to also fill out applications. One shouldn’t only pray to know God’s will, but also read his Word where His Will is revealed. God doesn’t throw worms in the mouths (beaks) of birds, but as they are searching He makes sure they find them. Not everything you deem as good will God merit as good and His perspective is always true. What good are you doing at this time in your life?

Thirdly, “Be fed.” As you trust in the Lord and do good, God promises, “You shall be fed.” Fed what? God will meet your needs according to His great and precious promises. God will feed you with the substance of His Word as you do good to read it. Jesus said, “… man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word of God.” He Promises to also fill us with His Holy Spirit as we stay away from being filled by ungodly things. Everything God makes God fills. He made the waters and filled is with marine life; He made the earth and filled it with plant life, animals and humanity. He fed Elijah by Ravens, and He will feed you by His good Hand as well. Only go Him for your daily bread and everlasting water.

Trust Him today, do good as you are trusting, and be fed by the Hand of the Master. To be continued…

title.rendered: From Give Me To Make Me, Part 1

content.rendered:
Good morning,

 Luke 15:11-32, “But when he came to himself, he said, …I will arise and go to my father and will say to him, “Father, I have sinned against heaven and before you”

 Remember the first time you came to know the Lord not about Him, you were excited about the great change that was taking place. It was like honeymoon, everything was going on well, prayers were being answered before you even prayed and even after you prayed. You couldn’t wait to tell friends about the dramatic change in your life. The joy, the happiness, peace was just great. I remember those times in my life. When a baby is born, there is great excitement because of the arrival, the child is fed on baby food, cared for and natured. As time goes by, they begin to teach him different things in preparation for the life a head. Everything he is taught is to make him stronger and stronger to face life and so are the newly weds, the honeymoon gets over and life begins in working on perfecting the marriage.

 There was a certain man who had two sons starting in Luke 15:11, this is the parable of the prodigal son. Here is a son who knows that there is an heritance for him, he knows his father, he knows the heart of his father but he asks for what belongs to him and leaves for a far country, far from home where he cannot encounter with the father and his brother anymore. I see many people who had God present in their lives as their Father but not too long after being blessed, changed, transformed, honeymooned, they took all that they had received and went a far off fleeing from the presence of the Father who loves us all.

 Luke 15:14, “But when he had spent all, there rose a severe famine in that land, and he began to be in want” The problem about withdrawing everything from your account is that it leaves you with nothing. You can only withdraw what has been deposited in your account by either by you or someone else. This young man left with an account fully loaded, a loving father deposited in his account, but he spent it all and then famine hit. The young man thought that with all the goods in his possession, he did not need the father. He made new friends when he had things but remember friends come and go. This is reality, he who has much has many friends but when the things go, friends go too. I need friends the most when the going gets tough and not when I have everything in place. He must have wondered, “where are all my friends when I need them????”. How many have been disappointed by friends? There are some things friends will not help you with, not even a brother but our heavenly Father who sticks closer than a brother. He does not leave us, we are the ones who choose to leave Him for the benefits. This young man hit the rock bottom when he found himself taking care of pigs and eating pigs food. Imagine starting from being a son, a wealthy son to feeding pigs and eating pigs food. Desperate people do desperate things, desperate people are humbled. Far from home with nothing and guilty of what he did.

 Got to stop for today, are you in the Father’s house or are you at a far country because you left the Father’s house? Are you waiting to hit a rock bottom before you make an intelligent decision. Think about your life, where are you with the Father? Isaiah 40:8, “The grass withers, the flowers fades, But the word of our God stands forever”, Careers, wealth, friends, positions come and go but God stands forever.
 Thanks
 Evans

title.rendered: From Give Me To Make Me, Part 1
My Mind Is Made Up

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Psalm 100:1-5, 1 Make a joyful shout to the LORD, all you lands! 2Serve the LORD with gladness; Come before His presence with singing. 3Know that the LORD, He is God; It is He who has made us, and not we ourselves;[1] We are His people and the sheep of His pasture. 4Enter into His gates with thanksgiving, And into His courts with praise. Be thankful to Him, and bless His name. 5For the LORD is good; His mercy is everlasting,

And it’s very important to start your day on a good note, it has a way of affecting your entire day. I tend to be very busy and spent many times but it matters a lot to me how I start my day.
 We all have a way of affecting how we start the day, it’s a choice that we’ve got to make and declare otherwise we become victims of stress, frustrations and lack happiness trying to do what is right. The bible tells us that  ” the joy of the Lord is my strength ” . If we take a close look at the word joy, it’s more than happiness for happiness tend to go with how you feel at a given time especially when everything is going the right way while joy comes when you know that regardless of what you have to deal with whether going forward or backward, you will make it in other words rejoicing in the end result rather than the process. The joy of the Lord make us comfortable in the situations that make other people uncomfortable.
Psalm 100 is a psalm of joy and singing, it starts with make a joyful shout to the Lord. I don’t have to shout joyfully to be heard by people, I can shout inside and when my inside is affected, my outside appearance will be the result of what is going on inside. Serving the Lord with gladness is awesome for I know that whenever I sit to work at my station, I’m working and serving the Lord. This is a blessed time where I come in the morning to work and say Lord, I thank you for another opportunity to serve in my department and serve others that I may shine for you at my work place. You see His word says that whatsoever thy hand finds to do, do it with all of you might without murmuring or complaining and the Lord of reward shall reward thee.

 Come before His presence with singing. I believe that music is the greatest tool used to uplift. There is nothing I know people respond to like music and that is why we can buy music over and over again, we can have hundreds of music collections. We can listen to music over and over again. The bible says that the Lord inhabits the praises of His people and we do a lot of praises through singing and listening to music. I love music and I can’t work like I need to without it because the more I praise my Lord through music, the more He energizes me to do my work. You got to give something to get something. A song with you will help you go through the day. When King Saul was being tormented by evil spirits, guess what they did, they had David playing music in his presence and the more he played, the quicker the evil spirit left. Replace your worries and anxieties with a song in your ear.

 Enter into His gates with thanksgiving and into His courts with praise. I love this line for this reminds me to go beyond where I am. Entering into His gates and into His courts allows me to leave outside everything that will interfere with my praise while I’m serving Him everyday. There is power in thanksgiving and when I enter into His gates, I begin to see that He has done more that I need to thank Him for and not always concentrate on what I’ve got to gain from Him everyday.
 This is a choice everyone has to make, yes we will have so much on our plates that we need to accomplish and yes we will be dealing with tough customers through the phone but we have been given the power to change the course of the day by allowing the joy of the Lord to be our strength. Keep a song with you, enter His gates and into His courts, refuse anything that will steal your praise, have a thankful heart and joy and be a beacon of light.  My mind is made up to start and finish the day well: I’ve said it, I mean it and I’m here to represent it!!!!!

 Have a joyous day!!!

 Thanks
 Evans

title.rendered: There Is A Guide, Part 4

content.rendered:
Good morning,

 Genesis 24:1-66, “…you will not take a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites, among whom I dwell; but you shall go to my country and to my family, and take wife for my son Isaac”

 I would like to finish the series we have been looking at, there is so much I could share from the passage but I would like to jump right towards the end and talk about something that can be so scary yet all need it. We have been talking about being guided from what we shouldn’t do, to what direction to take, what to pray for and to wait and see what the Lord would have for us and this can be seen by the steps of Abraham’s servant. Abraham ‘ s servant later met Rebekah ‘ s family, told them of everything and they also felt this was God ‘ s leading so they released her to be Isaacs wife.

 Genesis 24:62, “Now Isaac came from the way of Beer Lahai Roi, … vs. 63 “And Isaac went out to meditate in the field in the evening; and he lifted his eyes and looked, there, the camel were coming”. vs. 64, “Then Rebekah lifted her eyes and when she saw Isaac she dismounted from her camel”. On this verse, Abraham ‘ s servant is bringing Rebekah to meet her future husband. Isaac is in the field minding his own business, I believe he would come to the field in the evening to meditate fulfilling Psalm 1:2, “But his delight is in the law of the Lord, And in His law he meditates day and night”, He must have been meditating on the law of God to give him guidance, not only that, he must have been meditating on the Lord which is having a vertical relationship with the Lord and with time, he looked up and saw Rebekah approaching. We remember how Rebekah on the other hand was busy serving Abraham’s servant without any agenda and God graciously brings them together while busy serving . The bible says that Isaac and Rebekah both lifted their eyes and saw each other. They were both walking towards each other to meet for the first time. There is a guide when you can patiently wait for the Master to lead you to your right companion while you are busy serving. Many are busy looking that they neglect what they should be doing with their single hood.  Contentment leads to fulfillment knowing that God knows and He is in control.  Be busy taking care of God’s business, in due time God will make a way for you. Isaac and Rebekah did not know that some people were working towards bringing them together. It would be a blessing to know that God guided you and I to our right companions. Settle for the best!!!!

 Genesis 24:67, “The Isaac brought her into his mother Sarah’s tent; … and he loved her. My greatest message this morning is the love part which I’m not going to define according to the worldly way but according to the bible way. When the bible talks about love it defines it this way in 1Corinthians 13:4, “Love suffers long and is kind; love does not envy, love does not parade itself, is not puffed up vs. 5, does not behave rudely, does not seek it’s own, is not provoked, thinks no evil, vs. 6 does not rejoice in iniquity, but rejoices in the truth; vs. 7 bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things endures all things vs. 8 Love never fails”. How will one learn what love is if th ey do not have a solid vertical relationship?, what we have learned from our Father is what we  will execute in our earthly horizontal relationships. Isaac is taking good care of what God has blessed him with for she was the best in Isaac’s eyes. God has loved us so much that He has shown us what His love is all about and now we can do the same with our wives and husbands, family, companions. Isaac loved Rebekah, meaning he kept all this things that define what love is and I will confidently say that as he was busy serving the Lord, he was being prepared, shaped and channeled to love unconditionally. Love needs work otherwise soon before long it’s thrown out. Isaac deposited all the qualities of love in Rebekah and Rebekah did the same. Let me say one thing, both of them were not perfect because if you read in the later chapte rs Isaac lied about his wife and his wife helped her son deceive Isaac but Love prevailed.

 For those who are not married and desire to know who God has for them, I want you to remember that there is a guide. God is at work behind the curtains preparing you and your companion to be, be praying and wait patiently watching like Abraham’s servant to know what God will do. As you pray to God, He will give you guidance through the Holy Spirit on how to specifically pray for your desire. Be busy serving as you get prepared, know that God is in control, don’t look in the world for your companion, go back and relax in His house among His people and when He does bless you, be faithful to love according to God’s way. Now I definitely know that there is a guide, thank You Lord for being the guide!!
