Good morning friends,

Jonah 1-4, "And said, I cried by reason of mine affliction unto the Lord and he heard me; out of the belly of hell cried I, and thou heardest my voice"

Chapter 1:17, "Now the Lord had prepared a great fish to swallow Jonah. And Jonah was in the belly of the fish three days and three nights". I have met people who blame God for what they brought upon themselves. People who did terrible things that landed them even in jail and yet they stand out there and say, "why did God do this to me or why did God allow this to happen to me?". It's the choice made by an individual that will cause them to either suffer or be safe. In this case, though Jonah brings all the calamities upon himself and deserves to die, in the midst of his foolishness God is still gracious to him. Now you might say how was God gracious to him if He had prepared a great fish to swallow him? Someone else would also say to me that how was God gracious when he allowed me to go to prison or be down and broken, well let me tell you, something worse than where you were could have happened but His hand of mercy kept us from the worst things that could have happened. It's not that they could not happen, He kept them from happening. I am not better than those who have already gone to an early grave, the worst could have happened to me too but he preserved me even in the mess I was in. Jonah could have drowned without repenting and we don't know what could have happened to him in eternity. Being that he was in the sea, he could had been torn into pieces by the sea creatures but God preserved his life by allowing a great fish to swallow him that eventually he will have a chance to repent.

Jonah is acting what Jesus would do many years after his incident. Even in his foolishness and not knowing what he was doing, he was acting what Jesus would do. Jonah being in the belly of the fish three days and three nights shows what Jesus did when He died on the cross and was buried. He was in the tomb three days and on that third day He rose again and became a winner over death. While we are still on the subject of being swallowed by fish, Jonah is covered by a lot of yucky stuff, he is in a place of no freedom, nothing to eat, dark place, can't move and he is not a ware of where he is apart from knowing he is swallowed. I think this is the time when people appreciate what they had before they landed in the worst places and I bet a lot of things were going on in the mind of Jonah about how he landed in all this, he had a chance to repent but he blew it, he almost drowned but God was still there to show him love and mercy. He began to evaluate his life and how he had made it this far by the grace of God. God still loves His people and will always fight for them even when they fail because HIS LOVE IS NOT BASED ON WHAT WE DID BUT WHAT HE'S SON DID ON THE CROSS. title.rendered: When He Calls Me, Part 3

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Jonah 1-4, "And said, I cried by reason of mine affliction unto the Lord and he heard me; out of the belly of hell cried I, and thou heardest my voice"

When Jonah was woken out of his sleep, all the men decided to cast lots to see who was the reason for the obstacles. Many knew that any time something was not happening right, most likely someone had sinned and the only way they could deal with it was to zero out the victim and deal with that sin so as to have peace again. The situation would not change until the issue was dealt with. It's even with us today, many of our prayers will not be answered even though they may be genuine until sin is dealt with in our lives. We cannot shout on top of sin, we got to deal with it. 1John 1:8, "If we say we have no sin, we deceive ourselves and the truth is not in us", meaning that if we say we have no sin, we are calling Him a liar. Sin for sure will hinder us from getting where the Lord wants us to be. Our friend Jonah begins to explain how he ran from the presence of the Lord after refusing to take the assignment he had been given. The men in the ship are afraid because they are suffering for the sake of someone's sin.

Chapter 1:12, "And he said unto them, take me up, and cast me forth into the sea; so shall the sea be calm unto you: for I know that for my sake this great tempest is upon you". Surprisingly enough, he has shared with the men in the ship about what he has done, he is in a position to repent and allow God to forgive him but instead, he wants people to drown him. The bible says the Lord is good and gracious, slow to anger, He rescues them that call upon His name. 1John 1:9, "But if we confess our sins, He is faithful and just to forgive us of all our sins and cleanse us from all unrighteousness". Well we could say that Jonah is tough headed but while we are at it, how many times have I messed up and when I had a chance to repent and be cleansed again I ignored and kept on trying to run away from Him? We have been talking about trying to run away from His presence but let's use something in the natural to strengthen that, when I was 2 years old, that is about 18 years ago, when the sun came up, I could see my shadow just before me or behind me. Many times I tried to run away from my shadow but could never escape from it for it was always with me. When we came to Christ, His light was shone upon us and we saw Him as He is and we can never escape His presence. You might say that I haven't seen the light yet, well His presence is always with you, the light gives the proof that He never leaves us.

Chapter 1:13, "Nevertheless the men rowed hard to bring it to the land: but they could not: for the sea wrought, and was tempestuous against them". Instead of the men even encouraging Jonah to repent and be saved, they tried their human effort to bring the ship to the land safely by fighting the waves. Pause for a second, God is in control here and men want to be their own god, lead themselves to safety without His help, trying hard to do what only God can do? I'm not surprised, we always do the same trying to do it in another way when we know the right way to do it. Trying to escape from the responsibility we got to deal with. So they failed to beat God in His game and Jonah is thrown into the sea. I ask myself a question here, was he willing to die just because of his disobedience? Are we willing to suffer more because we have refused to repent?

We know that it's not by might nor by power but by His Spirit says the Lord Zech 4:6, it's a simple as that, in as much as we might try and fix it ourselves like the men in the ship, it will not work out for we are trying to fix the spiritual stuff through the flesh.

title.rendered: Giving Back to the Lord, by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
1Sa 1:10 "In bitterness of soul Hannah wept much and prayed to the LORD. 1Sa 1:11 And she made a vow, saying, "O LORD Almighty , if you will only look upon your servant's misery and remember me, and not forget your servant but give her a son, then I will give him to the LORD for all the days of his life, and no razor will ever be used on his head." (1 Samuel 1:10 – 11)

Our society is one that thrives on ownership. There are copyright laws on movies, songs, books, and deeds for houses, and titles for cars, etc… all showing owner of things. However when one has a child to whom does that child belong? The Psalmist wrote, Ps 127:3 Sons are a heritage from the LORD, children a reward from Him." In the book of Samuel we are met by a woman that was in bitterness of soul because she was barren. In those days to be barren was considered to be cursed by God. Hannah would weep and fast from food because she so wanted a son so bad and her heart was in deep anguish.

Hannah vows a vow and tells the Lord that if He will grant her a son, she will give him back to the Lord all the days of his life. Wow, if the Lord gives her what she yearns for she will give her son away to the Lord. God takes our vows very seriously as Solomon points out in Ecclesiastes 5:4, "When you make a vow to God, do not delay in fulfilling it. He has no pleasure in fools; fulfill your vow. 5 It is better not to vow than to make a vow and not fulfill it." Hannah makes her vow in prayer to the Lord, and Eli the priest confirms the answer from the Lord, that indeed God has heard her prayer, and she will have a son. This word from the Lord lifted her spirit and she was sad no longer. God's Word met her right where she was, He met sadness with joy, hopelessness with hope, and barrenness with a child. Her son is born, which would become the prophet Samuel which would later anoint King David to the throne of Israel. Hannah's prayer was desperate, selfless, and committed.

1. Desperate prayer. Hannah was in a time of desperation. Much more can be said of women in those days bearing children, but this was her hearts desire and she brought it to God. Where do you bring your deepest hearts desires, your dreams, your vision? Do you bring them to the Lord, or elsewhere?

2. Selfless prayer. Hannah's prayer was answered, and "unto her a child was given." However she promised God that she would give Him to the Lord all the days of Samuels life. The very child she was desperate for, she was willing to give back to her Lord as a gift back to Him. Are you selfish in your prayers, or selfless? Jesus prayed, "not my will be your be done." Before we can pray "Thy Kingdom come [thy will be done]," we must be willing to pray "my kingdom go [my will be gone] ALAN REDPATH."

3. Committed prayer. Hannah did not delay on fulfilling her vow to the Lord. Hannah brought Samuel to Eli the prophet and he was offered up to the Lord saying, "Oh my lord, as thy soul liveth, my lord, I am the woman that stood by thee here, praying unto the LORD. 27 For this child I prayed; and the LORD hath given me my petition which I asked of him: 28 Therefore also I have lent him to the LORD; as long as he liveth he shall be lent to the LORD." When God answers your prayer in a vow do your keep your end of the vow?

Are you desperate for the Lord? Is your prayer selfless and are you committed to serve Him with that which He gives you, whether things or people. Give to the Lord that which He has given you.

title.rendered: When He Calls Me, Part 2

content.rendered:
Jonah 1-4, "And said, I cried by reason of mine affliction unto the Lord and he heard me; out of the belly of hell cried I, and thou heardest my voice"

Yesterday we looked at the first verse of the first chapter of the book of Jonah. We looked at three important keys Word, Arise and Go. Like I mentioned yesterday, there are times where God will give us a certain assignment to accomplish and if you know about assignments, they are at times short term or long term but the key word to accomplishing the assignment is being faithful till the end.

Let's look at what Jonah does when he receives the assignment. Vs. 3, "But Jonah rose up to flee unto Tarshish from the presence of the Lord…" Jonah should know very well that you can never run a way from the presence of the Lord for the Lord is ever present everywhere. Psalm 139 talks about how God knows us from the beginning to the end, He knows when we sit and when we stand, He is familiar with our ways. David continues to say, "Lord if I put my bed in heaven, there you are, and if I put my bed in hell, there you are and if I took the wings of the morning and ascended to the uttermost parts of the earth, You will still be there". Right now there are many who are trying to run away from God. They know they are being convicted of things and instead of obeying the Lord, they have decided to run away from the presence of the Lord like Jonah. May I remind us this morning that what God has designed for us to do, no one else will come and do it on our behalf. We can run all we want but eventually we will have to answer to that call. John 15:16, "You have not chosen me, but I have chosen you, and ordained you, that you should go and forth fruit, and that your fruit should remain" We did not choose Him, He chose us for a reason and for a purpose. You might say, "well it's me who decided to follow Christ, I walked to the altar, I said the sinners prayer and I got saved". The truth of the matter is, when you gave your life to Christ, He chose you, put the right words in your heart, convicted you and caused you to see that the things which you always thought were foolish were actually good news. The bible says, "a man cannot come to the Lord unless the Spirit draws him"

Jonah boarded a ship to go the opposite direction for he has his own good reasons for not responding to the call. Well everything seams to be going on well as planned by him but God will not let you do the opposite when He has a plan to save and deliver yourself and many. God wasn't going to allow Jonah to abandon the assignment and let a whole city go to hell simply because he did not want to do it. So what does the Lord do, even in the midst of Jonah's foolishness, He is still demonstrating His power, number one to get Jonah know who the Boss is and number two to turn the hearts of some men who were worshiping idols. vs. 4&5, "But the Lord sent out a great wind into the sea, and there was a mighty tempest in the sea, so that the ship was like to be brake. Then the mariners were afraid, and cried every man unto his god, and cast forth the luggage that were in the ship into the sea, to lighten it for them. But Jonah was gone down into the sides of the ship; and he lay and was fast a sleep". Our disobedience can make many suffer. We may be comfortable somewhere but someone somewhere will be hurting simply because of what we did or did not do. Remember in the OT, if one man sinned, the whole family suffered. Thank God, even the midst of our foolishness, God remains faithful. Watch something here, the men in the ship prayed to their gods, and their gods could not save them, they tried the human effort of getting rid of some stuff in their ship, but still that did not work out and let's look at vs. 6, "so the shipmaster came to him (Jonah), and said unto him, what do you mean, O sleeper? Arise, call upon thy God, if so be that God will think upon us, that we perish not". Amazing right, we see men who never called on the true God, they meet a man of God for the anointing of God was upon him and I bet that is how they could tell that he worshiped the true God and they say to him, "call upon thy God". Romans 10:13, "Whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved, Psalm 18:3, "I will call upon the Lord who is worthy to be praised so shall I be saved from my enemies".

I thank God that even in the midst of my foolishness He still shows Himself mighty through me that many may know Him. Jonah does not know that "All things are working together for good to them that love God and to them that are called". It will cost him dearly for the disobedience but the work will still have to be done. Remember when David sinned by committing adultery with Bathsheeba, even in his failure, God had prepared something good out of it. Yes He suffered the consequences but out of that marriage, Solomon was born to become the wisest and a rich man. God does not want anyone to fall but if we do, He has already prepared something good out of our failure.

title.rendered: Today’s Message: When He Calls Me, Part 1

content.rendered:
Jonah 1-4, "And said, I cried by reason of mine affliction unto the Lord and he heard me; out of the belly of hell cried I, and thou heardest my voice"

When you begin to read this book, you will find that there is a specific task that God has for Jonah that He requires Him to complete it. We are not told of who Jonah was, his calling, how he grew up for this is not very important to the revelation of the text. We are also not told of how he aged and died but we are only told of his assignment, his reaction and his action. I believe that there are certain times in life where God will give us an assignment at times for a given period of time for He has desired to do something during the time of the assignment. Sometimes in 98, I was given an assignment to pray for schools. During that time there was so much going on in schools and Godlaid a burden in some hearts including mine to seriously pray for schools. I do still pray for schools but the intensity I had when the assignment was given was greater than now. What I am saying is that when God gives an assignment, He has already set up enough grace, strength and the ability for one to do it.

Chapter 1:1, "Now the word of the Lord came unto Jonah the son of Amittai saying, Arise, go to Nineveh, that city, great city and cry against it; for their wickedness is come up before me". We are introduced to some neat things in just verse one to which we will break it down as time goes by. The word of the Lord is present meaning a live everyday. It's always a now word for the Lord Himself is the Word. We hear Him introduce Himself as the "I AM" in the bible. Hebrews 4:12, "The word of the Lord is living and powerful…" we see it again as not a dead word or a word that will live but a word that is already living and this is the word that comes to Jonah. Number one point, the WORD coming, after the word comes, the first instruction in the word is ARISE. I would interpret as coming out of what someone has been in because of the word and making the first move by obeying the voice. Then GO which is to change locations by allowing a motion to take place.

The three, WORD, ARISE and GO are very familiar to us in the bible for we see the Lord constantly using them when getting ready to do something. He is always in the business of speaking and in His speaking there are clear instructions as to what is to be done. We also have this kind of calling in our lives where the word comes, we arise and we go. The bible says , "go into all the world and preach the gospel to every creature". We don't hear about sit ye but go ye. I love the sit ye part but that is not the instructions. The words of the Lord are always action and doing words for He is constantly on the move, He is always doing something and we are part of these things He is doing. Ready for a move?

title.rendered: God’s Decrease, Your Increase (Sifting for Victory) Part 2 – by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
"During that night the LORD said to Gideon, "Get up, go down against the camp, because I am going to give it into your hands. If you are afraid to attack, go down to the camp with your servant Purah and listen to what they are saying. Afterward, you will be encouraged to attack the camp." So he and Purah his servant went down to the outposts of the camp. (Judges 7: 9 – 11)

Gideon's army was less then 1 percent of its original size after the shifting took place, when God cut the majority of troops from the team through the leadership of Gideon. Gideon is resting at night, and God interrupts his rest with urgent orders to respond to divinely urgent news. Gideon is commanded to get up because God is going to give him the victory if he would attack immediately. Knowing Gideon's heart, God sees Gideon's fear, and responds to it with encouragement. Although faith is the opposite of fear at times we need to be navigated from one point to the other on the vehicle of encouragement. God told Gideon if you are too afraid to attack right now then spy on your enemies and eavesdrop on their conversation, you will be encouraged by what you hear. What could they possible hear from the enemy that would give them encouragement?

In sports competition I would love it if the opposing team would begin to fight against themselves, or when they would somehow lose heart. A divided team can't stand, and a team that has no heart because it is gripped by fear has crippled themselves before engaging in the battle. At this point both armies were fearful of one another, but God was about to rip the fear from Gideon's heart and encourage him, thus replacing fear with faith. Gideon and Purah (most likely his armor-bearer) eavesdrop on the enemies camp and, "Gideon arrived just as a man was telling a friend his dream. "I had a dream," he was saying. "A round loaf of barley bread came tumbling into the Midianite camp. It struck the tent with such force that the tent overturned and collapsed." His friend responded, "This can be nothing other than the sword of Gideon son of Joash, the Israelite. God has given the Midianites and the whole camp into his hands." No doubt this dream came from God to their enemies, as the fear of Gideon's sword ransacked their minds, gripping them with fear, discouragement, and defeat, before the battle was even engaged. I believe it was at this point that Gideon finally believed God. There are some great truth here for God's present day soldiers, you and me.

1. God's Word is timely. We are bound by the realm of time, and God is not. God told Gideon to go now to either battle or eavesdrop and Gideon obeyed. Our enemies are defeated already, but we need to listen to God's Word to be reminded of that truth. Jesus said in John 8:31 – 32, "If you…continue in my word…the truth will set you free." God's Word brings freedom if we apply it. Are you a hearer of God's Word or a doer of God's Word?

2. God's Word is encouraging. We've all been discouraged. Gideon's army was decreased yet the battle was still on the horizon. Both armies were gripped with fear, but God cares for his people, and meets our discouragement with encouragement, fighting fear with faith. Are you discouraged today, I've been there many times, go to God's Word but you need not go alone.

3. God's Word brings partnership. Gideon was commanded to go with Purah, his confidant, his close trustworthy partner. I can picture them smiling with huge grins at each other and being able to encourage one another. Now there were two people bringing encouragement back to the camp together. We need a close partner, who is yours? Do you encourage each other?

Battles are here, more are coming, but God's Word is timely, encouraging, and brings partnership. God is victorious, let us act by faith upon his Word by being obedient to Him, regardless of the fear that grips our hearts. Go to God's Word and allow it to silence the fear that grips you.

content.rendered:
"The LORD said to Gideon, "You have too many men for me to deliver Midian into their hands. In order that Israel may not boast against me that her own strength has saved her," (Judges 7:2)

When you are facing a difficult battle ahead does it make sense to decrease your weapons? Gideon was the leader of Israel's army, and God would decrease the size of Gideon's army with a battle just on the horizon. The Lord's instructions probably came as a complete shock to Gideon. I can imagine the he was confused upon hearing, "You have too many men for me to deliver Midian into their hands." That doesn't sound very sensible to me; decrease your army size, because there are too many men for battle. Gideon's army was already outnumbered four to one. When I was trying out for sports teams growing up, if one didn't qualify for the team they were cut from the team, so that only the best players were left to produce a winning team. There were usually two cuts that took place. This is what God did when he sifted Gideon's army. God cut the first wave of people from the team by having Gideon announce, "Anyone who trembles with fear may turn back and leave Mount Gilead." The result was that "twenty-two thousand men left, while ten thousand remained." The first cut allowed the cowards to disqualify themselves and go back home to mommy. Now God would have second cuts, and reduce Gideon's army even further. A special examination or screening was set up based on the manner of water drinking among the 10,000 remaining soldiers. There the LORD told him, "Separate those who lap the water with their tongues like a dog from those who kneel down to drink." (7:4) Three hundred men lapped with their hands to their mouths. All the rest got down on their knees to drink." Those that kneeled down to drink were cut, and those that apparently crouched down to scoop up water by using their hands as a dog uses its tongue remained. The LORD said to Gideon, "With the three hundred men that lapped I will save you and give the Midianites into your hands." The size of the army went from 32,000 to 1,000 to a mere 300 men to fight. Why would God do such a thing?

1. God can do a lot with a little. God can bring a victory with a few as easily as he could with a large army. Israel would not be able to boast about their victory, as the Lord removed all ground for boasting. Sometimes God reduces you in order to prepare you to move forward, and increase you. John the Baptist said, "He must Increase, I must decrease (John 3:30)." But this is not all.

2. God decreases us to show Himself strong. God said, "…for my power is made perfect in weakness." [Paul replied] Therefore I will boast all the more gladly about my weaknesses, so that Christ's power may rest on me." The world needs to see God's power through your weakness. Are you shinning brightly, or dimly?

3. God Knows those that are willing to take risks for Him. Not everyone is willing to obey God when things seem illogical on the surface. Sifting Gideon's army for battle is not good military strategy in the natural, but in the supernatural it was just what the Master ordered, and Gideon obeyed. What would you have done?

God can do a lot with very little to show Himself strong, and He knows those that are willing to take risks for Him even when "reason" says otherwise. I, you, we serve a victorious God. What is He asking you to do without to accomplish His will? Are you willing to take that risk?

Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil <><

title.rendered: There Is Safety Within, By Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Psalm 91:1, "He who dwells in the secret place of the Most High shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty".

Time and time again we all look for that place where we can have complete rest and restoration. When you are overwhelmed by the burdens, cares, frustrations you have to go through, which place do you go to relieve your burdens?. Who does not love vacation where you go a way, forget about the normal routine of what you should do, how you should do it and what results to expect at the end. You shut out stresses and concentrate on freedom to enjoy and gain strength, relax and heal, and let someone else worry about it. A cartoon in a newspaper presented this picture dialogue between a husband and wife. Both are in bed sleeping but in the middle of the night, the husband wakes up, restless, smoking and very worried. The loving wife inquires what's troubling him. Due to lack of finances, he is in no position to pay next month's rent. Listen to his wife's advise, "WHY NOT CALL THE LANDLORD, TELL HIM YOU CAN'T PAY NEXT MONTH'S RENT AND LET HIM BE THE ONE TO WORRY".

You worry about what hasn't even happened yet, stressed out by a lot of thinking, weary by trying so hard, frustrated by people and situations and your cry is, "I wish I could take a vacation". "He who dwells in the secret place of the Most High", what a way to begin the scripture, it does not start with "when". "When" talks about time, meaning things will begin to happen after someone or something does take place, but "HE WHO" which is an action word, shows that the provision is there and we should already be doing it. A vacation to me is not when you go away but when you can rest and relax and let someone else worry about what worries you. "DWELLS" is word that shows living, residing, existing in a given place. This is where you have your address, everyone knows that you live there, this is also where all your stuffs are. Everyday after hard work, your destination is to your dwelling place. "IN THE SECRET PLACE", I wouldn't look at this as a place where I am trying to hide from everyone else but a place I have discovered. People say, "I have found the secret to my success", of course we can tell that they have discovered something that they did not know about. What you have discovered to improve your life is something that you will cherish, you will look forward to being there. In our scripture, the Psalmist has discovered a secret place he never knew of though it was always there. "MOST HIGH", allows us to understand that our secret place has no limitations for the One who is in charge has everything in place. "SHALL ABIDE UNDER THE SHADOW OF THE ALMIGHTY", Most High reveals that you and I are small and therefore we can abide (remain) under the shadow. I would imagine that shadow here means a mirrored image or reflection.

There is something about dwelling in the secret place that the Psalmist let's us know why he loves it there. It's a place of refuge and fortress Psalm 91:2, Proverbs 18:10, "The name of the Lord is a strong tower, the righteous run into it, and they are safe", it's a place of safety, deliverance, covering, shielded by faith, where darkness cannot comprehend, no destruction, where things fall left and right and none of it comes near you. A place where the wicked cannot make it but His angles are put in charge over you to keep you in all your ways. A place where you cannot dash your foot on the rocks and serpents have no power over you, why? Psalm 91:14, "Because he has set his love upon Me (the Lord), therefore I will deliver him". The more things the Lord does for him who dwells in the secret, Vs 14, 15, 16, "I will set him on high, because he has known my name, he shall call upon Me, and I will answer him; I will be with him in trouble; I will deliver him and honor him; With long life I will satisfy him, and show my salvation".

Those who know and love God will run to Him and dwell in His presence, they will make His presence their residing place, a place they call home. After dealing with everything, they will long to be in that place. Everything you ever needed to help you get your sanity back is within. To crown it all, I'm on vacation in the midst of all that I have to do and doing them because I have a secret place. CALL HIM AND LET HIM WORRY ABOUT IT CAUSE THERE IS SAFETY WITHIN AND NOT WITHOUT!!!!!

title.rendered: The Warrior Is A Child, by Evans

content.rendered:
Psalm 61:1-8, "…From the end of the earth I will cry to You, when my heart is overwhelmed; Lead me to the rock that is higher than I…"

We have all been allowed to be some type of garden. When you talk about a garden, you think of a prepared place for new things to be planted in. Seeds usually come in mind when talking about garden. Anything planted in that garden has the power to spring forth if natured, watered and kept well. There are things that we tend to look after or work on that are actually weeds and because we have put so much energy trying to care for the newly growing plants, we have also taken good care of the weeds that eventually have chocked the good that was growing. I heard this line from another preacher; "There is more power in the seed than in the sower". Any one can plant a good seed regardless of who they are but in as much as the sower might have skills if he has bad seeds, nothing will materialize.

If I had time, I would look at Mat 13:24-30 and talk more on that but I will leave that for another day. People get overwhelmed by responsibilities they have to deal with every day. While you are still working on this, there comes another one, while trying to work on another one, here comes a new one. I tend to believe that everything has its season and how we deal with a situation during a certain season will determine the outcome of it. The overwhelming situations have chocked out peace, confidence and courage, as the weeds do know how to chock out good plants. I know that someone this morning is dealing with overwhelming situations not just at work but even at home, let's see what the Lord has for us this morning.

Vs. 1 Hear my cry, O God, attend to my prayer, the first thing talked about in this line is prayer, have you prayed over your situation or did you wait for someone to come and lay hands on you for you to make it? Lay your own foundation and let someone else help you build the wall. I have met people that wanted to see things happen in their lives and the first question I would ask them, "Have you laid your foundation?", you can help build the wall but foundation has to be laid by an individual. What is the foundation, faith. Vs. 2 From the ends of the earth I will cry to You, When my heart is overwhelmed, Lead me to the rock that is higher than I, of course our hearts will get overwhelmed and so are our minds and bodies but what happens when they get overwhelmed? Please don't lead me to temptation, friends, neighbors, programs you name it, lead me to the Rock not just any rock, But the Rock that is higher than I. Why the rock, the rock cannot be overwhelmed, moved or shaken and if the rock is higher than I, I will make it my dwelling place as I can hide under it. Vs. 3 For you have been a shelter for me, A strong water from the enemy, I truly believe this as the bible says in Prov 18:10, "The name of the Lord is a strong tower, the righteous run into it and they are safe", just His name alone is a strong tower in other words a strong rock When you find yourself overwhelmed, calm your nerves, speak peace to yourself and be led to the rock that is higher than us. The bible says that in Nehemiah 8:10, "…for the joy of the Lord is your strength." The unbelievers ask me why I always have this joy even when things at times don't go right or when I am overwhelmed, it's because I have learnt the secret and that is the joy of the Lord is my strength. Vs. 8, So I will praise Your name forever, That I may daily perform my vows, ouch, the writer concludes the chapter with this line as in the process of hiding under the rock, he will continue to praise and be glad and daily perform his vows. We have vowed to be the best we can be at our jobs by God's grace without complaining or murmuring for it is God which works in you both to will and to do of His good pleasure, Phil 2:13. So keep on fighting the good fight of a soldier, enduring for He is your Rock of Ages, Strong Tower, Firm Foundation, Solid Rock, Anchor of you Life, need I say more?

To sum up, we are all children in warriors gear. God is our armor therefore we make it but there are times when it gets too much that we have to cry. But when they all see how we survive and make it, they don't know that beneath that armor, the warrior is just a child. "They don't know that I would go running home when I fall down, they don't know who picks me up when no one is around, sometimes I drop my sword and cry for a while, cause deep inside this armor, the warrior is just a child"

title.rendered: Hinged Upon Emptiness – By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
He is not here; he has risen, just as he said. Come and see the place where he lay." Matthew 28:6

Picture this, you are at a restaurant and the bill has just been handed to you. As you open your wallet or purse, you notice that it is empty. This would not be good. Empty hopes, empty promises, empty dreams, empty homes, and dare I say some seem to relate to those with empty minds. When one thinks of empty things, there is usually negativity attached to it. Emptiness usually speaks of something finished, over, void, etc…. The first time the term empty was used in the Scriptures it referred to the earth being "formless and empty, darkness was over the surface of the deep, and the Spirit of God was hovering over the waters." Emptiness was present, but so was the Spirit of God!

Let's fast forward to the time of Jesus, where emptiness was the greatest word that could have filled the air. "The angel said to the women, "Do not be afraid, for I know that you are looking for Jesus, who was crucified. 6 He is not here; he has risen, just as he said. Come and see the place where he lay." Upon seeing where Jesus' body had been placed by Joseph of Arimathea, they saw emptiness. The angel said it, but Jesus would confirm his words concerning the empty tomb. "So the women hurried away from the tomb, afraid yet filled with joy, and ran to tell his disciples. 9 Suddenly Jesus met them." Greetings," he said. They came to him, clasped his feet and worshiped him. 10 Then Jesus said to them, "Do not be afraid. Go and tell my brothers to go to Galilee; there they will see me."

This empty tomb is what all of Christianity hinges upon, an empty tomb! Paul said, "If there is no resurrection of the dead, then not even Christ has been raised. And if Christ has not been raised, our preaching is useless and so is your faith (1 Cor. 15:14)." All of Christianity hinges on this one time, occurrence, namely the empty tomb, hence the resurrection. If Jesus didn't rise from the dead then all of Christianity is dead, and deserves to be buried in a tomb never to be thought of again! We should not believe because someone told us to, because we have to believe in something, or even out of tradition. We should believe or disbelieve based on truth. After all who wants to believe a lie? However if the empty tomb is still speaking today of the truth of Christ's resurrection, we should embrace it, and worship Him and the risen Lord and Savior, because he defeated death, hell, and the grave, paying the penalty for the law that we broke. Is the empty tomb the biggest hoax in history or the great truth of all time? It is one or the other, and all must decide which side they are on, because in reality ones life depends upon the empty tomb. If Jesus didn't rise then God is a liar and we are all still in our sins, and our preaching and faith is in vain. If the dead are not raised, "Let us eat and drink, for tomorrow we die."

The empty tomb speaks of fulfilled promises of prophecy, restored dreams, transcendent truth, peaceful patience, and future hope. Yes my whole life hinges on Christ's resurrection, I don't want to be religious, but rather right (a follower of absolute truth). Can you say with full assurance this resurrection Sunday that your faith is hinged upon emptiness, the truth of the empty tomb. If so then pass your faith on, for neither your faith nor your labor is in vain.

Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil <><

title.rendered: Thank God For The Roman Soldier, by Evans

content.rendered:
Romans 11:16-24, "Thou wilt say then, the branches were broken off, that I might be grafted in"

It's very easy to be hard on our enemies especially when something good is involved. One thing that we have always been taught is that we have enemies we encounter with every single day of our lives at the same time we have been encouraged to fight some enemies and love some enemies. I have discovered that all things work together for good to them that love God and to them that are called according to His purpose, Rom 8:28, regardless of what that thing is, it still works for my good. Whether it was something bad planned against me, God would use it to make something good out of it. I believe that all enemies are not bad as some will cause you to pray again, trust in God, strengthen you. In the bible David sinned when he committed adultery with Bathsheeba, he suffered for his acts but God made something good out of his fall, Solomon a wise man, loved of God and very rich born out of that family. If that is not enough, when Samson messed us, he suffered for it but in the end God uses him in a mighty to destroy more enemies in his death than he did in his life. Over and over we see bad situations that God turns something good out of it. He always provides away for escape.

John 19:34," But one of the soldiers with a spear pierced his side, and forthwith came there out blood and water", Let's look at a man who just wants to finish a job started. Many had cried for Jesus to be crucified and finally they have the Son of God crucified between two thieves, He did not do anything to deserve the crucifixion like the two thieves but for our sake. He could have saved Himself but He chose to hang in there. After declaring that His work on earth was finished, He gave up the ghost. As they were about to lower His body for burial, one soldier pierced Him on His side to be sure He was dead. I thank God for the Roman soldier who had to do one last thing, pierce Him on the side. Everyone might condemn his act and so would I but I want us to look at the big picture. When he pierced Him on the side, out of His side came out water and blood for my sins, the bible calls Him the living water as that came out of His side that I might live and when the blood also came out of His side, it washed me from all of my sins.

The greatest thing I want us to get out of this is why he pierced Him on the side. John 15:5,"I am the vine and you are the branches, he that abides in me the same brings forth much fruit, for without me you can do nothing". The Roman soldier opened away for us to be grafted in, we were once attached to some wild trees that had bitter herbs, fruits and thorns, we were all growing in the cruel garden which is the world and when He died on the cross, we were cut off from those trees that we might be grafted on Him. If the grafting did not take place, my God I don't know where I would be today but when a way was opened, He allowed me to abide in Him as He is the vine and we are the branches. In the process of cutting and grafting, I lost some things but boy I gained more. The first fruit is holy and the roots are holy and when I got grafted in, I became like Him for now His blood is flowing through my veins, He is now feeding me and I can bare fruits because I am attached to Him. I don't have to worry about the outcome for He is in control, He's got everything in His hand all I have to do is abide and what I bare is a result of my attachment to Him. The process might take time as the branch will not just start baring fruit at once but it has to get used to being attached to the vine, flowing in the new fountain and adjusting it's life style and being conformed to the image of the Son of God. If at one point you detached yourself, Rom 11:23, "God is able to graft them (you) again" Are you completely grafted on Him? are your fruits a result of that grafting?. Lord I thank you for some of my enemies who have allowed me to experience you in a more dynamic way.

Happy Easter

title.rendered: What’s the deal with Barabbas (by David Jackson)

content.rendered:
Focus: Matt 27:1-26; Mark 15:1-15; Luke 23:1-25; John 18:39-19:16

Barabbas was a Jewish national/zealot. Hebrew custom establishes the idea that Jewish parents name their children based on certain characteristics. Barabbas means "son of the fathers"; that is, "Bar" means son and "abbas" means fathers. Growing up, I bet Barabbas thought he was something special. He was the hope of Jewish history (son of the fathers). His name suggests that the Jewish nation had a lot riding on his shoulders (son of the fathers). Barabbas was the product of the long line of Jewish wise men and sages (son of the fathers). He embodied and represented them. Little is known about his parents other than that they were political figures and did not raise him themselves. It is said that Barabbas was raised by the community- being groomed for a purpose. He was not raised with a lot of discipline.

Historically, Barabbas came on the scene during the interim between the old and new testaments. At that time, the Jewish people were subject to Roman power. Some said that Barabbas was a 'robin hood' character. He was hot-headed, quick tempered, and had little difficulty using violence to accomplish his goals. To him, the end justified the means and he didn't mind doing whatever he wanted, whenever, or by whatever means necessary. This lifestyle got Barabbas on Rome's top ten list of wanted men. He had led a revolt in which several Roman soldiers were killed. He had stolen from the roman and Jewish treasuries. He was known for ambushing people and taking their belongings to finance the initiatives of his motley crew. And, interestingly, we find him (the son of the fathers) in Roman custody when he is first mentioned in the gospels.

Romans kept their notorious criminals in a jail that was located in the garrison of soldiers. This jail would be equivalent of the maximum-security prisons of today. This jail was about a half mile from the governor's palace and tribunal.

The story opens with the Roman governor judging the case of Jesus. And, the governor gives the people a choice of choosing Jesus, the Son of God, or, Barabbas, the son of the fathers. Jesus was divine, Barabbas was not. Jesus was Son to God the Father and heir to heaven, Barabbas was son of human people and heir to a collapsed history and dejected people. Jesus represented choosing the divine while Barabbas represented choosing the least admirable qualities in us all. Truly, there was no comparison and the obvious choice of the people should have been to choose Jesus. Instead, the Jewish people chose Barabbas; the lesser figure, the substitute, the crook, the man.

But, this is not where I want us to contemplate. Let's contemplate the story as it unfolds from the viewpoint of Barabbas. He was locked up about a half mile from where Jesus was at. From where he was located, Barabbas could hear the words of the crowd as they shout their responses in unison.

I live less than a mile from RFK stadium, the home of Washington's field sports programs. While I don't hear the referees, I can easily hear the crowd shouting "touch-down" or "de-fense". I can tell what's going on because I can hear the crowds' woes and their happiness.

So, here's Barabbas- locked up in jail. Now, remember, he could hear the crowds shouting in unison – but he couldn't hear the governor. He hears the crowds scream:

  • Not this man, but Barabbas
  • Crucify him, crucify him
  • We have a law, and by our law he ought to die, because he made himself the Son of God
  • If thou let this man go, thou art not Caesar's friend: whosoever maketh himself a king speaketh against Caesar
  • Away with him, away with him, crucify him
  • His blood be on us, and on our children.Can you imagine what was going on in the mind of Barabbas? He had been in custody for a long time. He had not seen the face of another common person nor had he had a visitor in years. By this time, he was accustom to seeing the routine faces of the roman guards. No doubt he thought that the people had betrayed him- after all, he did all of his bad deeds FOR them, right? How dare they turn on him like this? He just heard the death sentence be pronounced on him. Now, imagine the dread and the fear that seized his soul. Imagine what the other prisoners thought or said to their "champion" as they heard the sentence. No doubt a reverent, dreadful silence fell over the place. There was a long wait. And then, they heard the footsteps and the keys clinging in the distance- getting closer and louder. They heard the guards returning for Barabbas. For all intents and purposes, they all, including Barabbas, thought Barabbas was going to be summarily executed. But, something happens when the doors are opened to his cell, and the instruments of death tell him that he was free to go. Imagine the fear- yet excitement he felt as the chains and the instruments of his captivity and imprisonment were removed. Then, imagine the solemnity that gripped him when he was told or came to realize that Jesus took his place!

    Application: This is the week of Christ's passion. As we reflect on these events, let's consider how many times we chose Barabbas over Jesus in our lives. Let us not forget the significance of the story. In Barabbas's mind- he was as good as dead. He heard the death sentence. But, Christ took his place. It is entirely possible that Barabbas went on to live a holy life after that. Perhaps, he realized the true meaning of the exchange and sacrifice that Christ made on HIS behalf- and it was enough to turn him around and truly live a life that was worth his dying for.

title.rendered: Such As I have, part 2, by Evans

content.rendered:
Blessed of God,

Acts 3:1-26, "…Then said Peter, "Silver and gold have I none but such as I have, I give thee…"

The moment we begin to concentrate on our weakness, we loose focus as our weakness overshadows our strengths. When you know your strengths, work hard on your strengths and you will see how your weaknesses will be balanced by your strengths.

Here comes Peter and John to the temple, I am positive that this was not the first time they had been to this temple and being that this was not the first time, they must have seen this man sitting by the gate and maybe at one point they gave him money. On this particular day the two boys were broke. You will agree with me that it's much easier to give someone something tangible than something invisible. And because we at times get used to giving out tangible things, we don't see anything greater beyond, no wonder the Lord keeps on elevating us to new levels ultimately for the spirit to arise and the flesh be removed. These two men had nothing to give according to the principles of the earthly kingdom but after they looked at whom they belonged to, they realized that there was something they could offer from the heavenly Kingdom.

Vs 4-6 And fixing his eyes on him, with John, Peter said, "look at us", so he gave attention, expecting to receive something from them. Then Peter said, "silver and gold have I none but such as I have I give to you". We deal with people everyday who are looking for answers and help, well the world has taught them to burry some of their problems in programs, drinking, socializing, and trying some other new methods. Actually this has worked but only for sometime as in the end, people started looking for something new. When John and Peter showed up, they were not going to give him the same things he had always received, they decided to give him something eternal Jesus. This man must have thought, "if silver and gold they do not have, what other thing better could they possibly offer me?".

In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, rise up and walk. One time I stopped by Putnam Hospital to see one of my young adults, in the process of talking to him, a gentleman came in who I began to share Christ with him. As I was talking to him, three more people joined us and all I could offer them was Christ. The doctors had offered them medication, their families had offered them love, comfort, acceptance and maybe finances, I had nothing to offer them but Jesus. Each and every one of us has something to give. I used to dwell so much on what I did not have and forgot that God had placed special gifts in me that very few people have and if you look at your life too, you will see great gifts God has placed in your life, knowing our strengths help us overcome our weakness.

Vs. 7&8, And he took him by the right hand and lifted him, and immediately his feet and anklebones received strength. So he, leaping up, stood and walked and entered the temple with them walking, leaping and praising the Lord". It's one thing to offer something to someone, it's another thing to extend your hand to him or her to reach and grab it. The reason being that their faith has not matured enough to see things the way you see them. Remember that he had been in his condition since birth, being told to rise up and walk was just too much to grasp, Peter reaches to him after speaking the words and helps him rise up and walk. The moment he rises up, all he can do is leap, walk and praise the Lord, he has kissed his business goodbye as what he has just received is too good to be wasted on begging. For the first time he goes to the temple with new friends he has just met. What a blessing for someone to hear that you've been praying for them, thinking about them, saying nice things to them and about them, if they felt that they were condemned to be in the same place forever, your actions will cause them to think twice. We as believers will many times feel like we are bound to be in the same place forever but that is okay as God knows how to send someone who will pump life into us, help us rise and keep on moving. If you've invited some of your friends of family members to church and they have not showed up, such as you have, give it to them for one day they will see what you've been offering and coming to church will crown it all.

Everyone has something to give and as they also had something to give they said, "Such As I Have I Give It To You"

title.rendered: Such As I have, part 1, by Evans

content.rendered:
Acts 3:1-26, “…Then said Peter, “Silver and gold have I none but such as I have, I give thee…”

We have been allowed to be part of what the Lord is doing in these last days. The bible says that in the last days God will pour out His Spirit upon all flesh and our sons and daughters will prophesy, the young men shall see visions and the old men shall dream dreams and in the last days, whoever will call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved. We have an awesome opportunity to affect and be affected by what the Lord is doing through us.

Peter and John are on their way to pray at a certain hour which happened to be the praying hour. They come to the temple and right outside the temple there is a gate called beautiful, right at the gate there is a lame man sitting out there begging for alms or in other words money. Here is a man who has been lame from his birth and everyday some people carried him to the gate. He must have had a booming business as they kept on brining him over there or that was the only place where people were generous. I bet that after sometime, the people who kept on bringing him over there must have been tired of doing so and maybe charging a fee would have made them keep on doing the job of bringing him to the gate.

Just to continue exploring this man’s life let’s see another thing that might have happened, he must have gotten comfortable there as he couldn’t see anything beyond his situation. I wonder whether there was any time in his life that he desired to know what was actually going on in the temple, oh well the business was booming and he was comfortable, why would he want to see what was happening beyond the gates. If I look at it well, many times I could relate to this fellow as there are certain things that I kind of ruled out that nothing good could come out of it and because of that, seating by the gate called beautiful was all I could do, maybe not looking for alms but looking for acceptance, affirmation, encouragements and the like. These helped but for a short time cause next day I would need them again. Often times when you have tried something and maybe at one point you saw yourself coming out of it and months go by which turns to years, you will agree with me that it’s hard to expect a change or something different about it.

God may take you through the desert but He will never leave you in the dessert as His promise is to bring you to the promise land. You may get comfortable around the mountain because He is providing manna and water but that is His away of sustaining you so that He can bring you to where He promised. This man’s life was being sustained for a certain time he was not aware of, he could have died before Peter and John showed up and that is also with us. As long as we are still breathing, we have to hope for something better than where we are. We all need to be packed up so that we can pass over, we are nomadic people meaning we are not scheduled to be where ever we are forever. I pray that we will never build a permanent solution on a temporary circumstance. So devil please don’t look for me where I was yesterday cause I will not be there. Where you found me was just a resting place getting me ready for the next move. I have sat by the gate for too long it’s time for me to rise and move, so don’t send me no telegram, mail or any package for I have no street address, if I have to pitch a tent, I will but come morning I will be gone. I know you are used to looking for me at the gate I have been pitying myself and begging but enough is enough. I had him say, weeping may endure for a night but joy comes in the morning, Psalm 30:5

People and situations may want to keep on bringing you to the gate and never inside, that’s okay. Thanks to them they brought you closer to your miracle cause God is now about to send someone who will speak a word that will cause you to see yourself through the eyes of faith and when you do so, you will kiss the gate goodbye. Something awesome will remind you that you are better than sitting at the gate asking for alms. My encouragement to us this morning is to refuse to be in the same place forever why cause my bible says, these too shall pass. No one has been in a situation for too long that the Lord cannot deal with it. 1Cor 2:9, “But as it’s written, Eye hath not seen, nor ear heard, neither have entered into the heart of man, the things which God hath prepared for them that love Him”

I will continue in the morning, have a blessed day.

title.rendered: Rest And Let God Handle The Rest, by Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Genesis 15:9-12, "And when the vultures came down on the carcasses, Abram drove them away"

You and I knows those times when we have so much to do and we want to do it all well. At times however hard you try, things do get out of control. You still may not be in a position to meet the dead lines, have things in place but heaven knows you have toiled. By the end of the day you wonder what you did today yet times passed by so fast. What you are left with after the day is over is exhaustion, some headache. Looking at the root cause of how it seams to appear, you realize that it's not headache but exhaustion and fatigue. The best cure for it is not medicine, the cure for it is rest.

Don't know about you but I am the type that will work and work for long hours trying my best to do what I should do, in the process, I find that I have pushed rest out of my normal routine, in the end I appear to be having a headache. In Genesis 15:1 the Lord appears to Abram in a vision and His words to him is, "Do not be afraid, Abram. I am your shield, your exceedingly great reward". In one line he is given one instruction and two promises. In other words, do not be afraid if you do not finish all you needed to do, don't feel bad that you failed to accomplish it why? because I am your shield. Believe it or not, no one understands what resting is all about like God. He created the earth in 6 days and on the 7th day He chilled and rested. His word to Abram is that I am your shield, protecting you from all that make you exhausted, bring fatigue, those things that appear to be like headache because I have called you into rest. God also tells Him that He is Abram's exceedingly great reward which I would interpret, the best you do, God rewards it. We do the best we can with the help of God, we live the rest for Him to handle as we go to rest. Abram upon hearing those encouraging words that he can do his best and not do everything and that God rewards those who work hard, Vs. 2, "But Abram said, "Lord, what will You give me, seeing I go childless… vs. 3, "Then Abram said, "look, You have given me no offspring; indeed one born in my house is my heir". Here is a man who knows the Lord, God has made promises that He will fulfill, he has done his best but desires an offspring who will rise from his family and continue to display what God had started through him.

Vs. 9, "So He (God) said to him, "Bring Me three year old heifer, a three year old female goat, a three year old ram, a turtle dove, and a young pigeon". I don't understand why the Lord wanted all this, all I do understand that obedience is the key to unlock the promises. The bible says that whatever good we do, we do it unto the Lord, be it serving people, trying our best to accomplish our assignments and goals, we are all doing this unto the Lord. Some of them don't make sense and you and I wonder why we have to do them but still the obedience to do it unto the Lord is the key. Mathew 5:16, "Let your light so shine before men that they may see your good works and glorify your Father which is in heaven". Doing good is representing God in the fallen world, we represent Him as a good God. Remember those days that you don't really feel like doing good, you want to do the worse, the day is not promising but you still do good anyway? that must have been with Abram doing what the Lord asked him to do. So he cut the animals but did not cut the birds and for the whole day all he tried to do was protect what he was offering to God. Genesis 15:11, "And when the vultures came down on the carcasses, Abram drove them away". I see this everyday when I offer myself to God for service, what happens? vultures of fear, frustrations, confusion, anger try to come in and for the whole day, I am chasing them away to protect that which I am offering to the Lord partially because the bible says, Romans 12:1, "Brethren I beseech you by the mercies of God that you present yourself a living sacrifice, holy and acceptable which is your reasonable service". The moment you surrender yourself as a sacrifice, all the vultures will be out to devour that sacrifice but chase the vultures away for His word says again, do not be weary in well doing.

When you have done all you can, the Lord takes over and gives you rest in the spirit, body, soul, mind. Vs 12, "Now when the sun was going down, a deep sleep fell upon Abram". You cannot sleep when you are troubled. Those who are troubled will be tossing back and forth on their bed, wondering of what they could have done better, how they missed the deadlines but here is a man who did the best he can and God gave him deep sleep, a time to rest while He takes care of the rest. Remember the Lord said to him in the beginning, "I am your shield". When you have done your best, close out everything, commend the rest to God and go to sleep, relax, enjoy doing other things that bring you joy and helps you gain your strength back. Even with ministry, at times it's good to go underground, relax, do things you like to do outside ministry, Ecclesiastes 5:18, "It is good and fitting for one to eat and drink, and enjoy the good of all his labor in which he toils under the sun all the days of his life which God gives him; for it is his heritage". God gives us all good things to enjoy but that cannot happen to a troubled person, it happens to those who have done their best and have committed the rest to the Lord. Therefore rest and let God handle your rest and the rest that you need to do.

title.rendered: Faith Comes By Hearing, by Evans

content.rendered:
Romans 10:17, "So then faith comes by hearing, and hearing by the word of God"

Commercials are one of the greatest tools the manufacturers use to convey messages about their new products in the market. Millions of dollars are poured into commercials with an aim to create an awareness of the latest products. The commercials are suppose to be catchy and you will agree with me of how many of them are funny, some with twisted humor. To some, hoping their commercials will sell. Why do people go for things they go for, either someone told them about it and convinced them that it works or they saw it on TV, heard it on radio, through bill boards, news papers and they got utterly convinced that is what they needed. The product will not do them much if they don't try it. For a fact, most of the commercials exaggerate what their products can do only to discover that it works for a short time and it's effectiveness is gone.

What does this have to do with what I am about to talk about, they all come back to being aware and putting that awareness into practice. We have talked about faith so many times but let this help build your faith. Faith is the confident belief in the truth, value, worthiness of a person, idea or a thing. It's being loyal to a person or a thing. If you told me your name, I must have faith to believe that you have told me the truth. If I said, "I don't believe you", you will get offended because I am insinuating that you are deceiving me with a name you have given. If you told me about where you live and I doubted it with you knowing, you will not take it kindly. What does Paul say about the author of faith in Hebrews 11:6, "For without faith it is impossible to please God…". You want to please God, you got have faith, faith in believing what He has said without doubting. The moment there is doubt, it's an indication of mistrust, and what an insult that is to God too. He has displayed his products to us inform of creation, He has seen us through over and over again therefore He is God who can be trusted, have faith in Him.

Faith is commitment. When the bible talks about FAITHFUL servant, it refers to one who is committed to a task because he has believed in the one who authored that task. It's away to build more faith because the person whom you hang around for long, their character is displayed, you have a better way of dealing with them when it comes to faith. It's evident when you look at certain people, you don't have faith in them, you cannot trust them with things like information or finances because they have no character to support that trust. Thanks be to God who is faithful, never leaks your information to someone else, does not mess with what you have trusted Him with. The children of God are people of faith, committed to this walk of life with Christ, 2Corinthians 5:7, "For we walk by faith and not by sight". It's a tough one but we are determined to ride it out because we want to please Him.

He that uses the product must first believe that it works and what is the testimony? I don't think faith just appears from nowhere and we believe it. It comes by hearing, hearing someone's testimony that God can, hearing the word that drills through the nutshell of doubt and unbelief. The continuous word spoken goes around that shell and begins to melt it down allowing it to have a new master FAITH (Forever All In Thy Hand). You can only come to someone because you know they have it, Christ does have it forever in His hands. Doubt is the an enemy of faith and it's comes easily, but faith needs a lot of force to occupy. Faith is gradual concurring one step at a time depending on what it's given to feed on. We have established what faith comes by, "Hearing", this presents a little problem because you could hear things but wrong things and for sure those can also build faith but only towards the wrong things. "It comes by hearing by the word of God". God's word is like the commercial that we see out there, the only difference is that His word are not exaggerated, nothing can be added to it and nothing can be taken away from it. It presents it self, defends it self and also proves itself. It never fails, it does not work for a season, it works always. It does not fall short of anything and it does not return void. What it starts, it will accomplish it. It's committed through the author to accomplish what it's meant for. When the word of God finds it's way into our hearts, it shoots faith with it to melt every doubt and unbelief to create room itself. Don't forget that faith draws a man to God. . Having faith in someone who you know cannot do it is being unwise, last time I checked God, I found that there is nothing impossible with Him, that He is Hebrews 12:2, "..author and the finisher of our faith…"

One little thing about faith and we are done for today. At your desk, you have your chair right? You can see from a distance that it can hold you. You have faith that it can hold you because either you have seen someone sit on it before and did not fall, or you look at it and you can see it's stability or you have sat on it before and therefore you have faith that it can do the job. Currently why is it not holding you? it's because you are not sitting on it. There are people who have faith that God can work in their lives but they are not experiencing that, why? because they believe from distance. The moment you make that step and sit on that chair, you would have shifted your faith and made it complete. Staying on it, makes you comfortable. As you sit on it, it will do the job of holding you, is this not what Christ is also offering us?, Hebrews 11:6,"…He that comes to God must first believe that He is and that He is a rewarder of them that diligently seek Him". Let your faith be boosted because you have heard the word.

Blessings
Evans

title.rendered: Communicating the Kingdom – Part 5 (Originally by Mark Rutland)

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Please enjoy the last part in the series Communicating the Kingdom.

"After his suffering, he showed himself to these men and gave many convincing proofs that he was alive. He appeared to them over a period of forty days and spoke about the kingdom of God." Acts 1:3

"Do you refuse to speak to me?" Pilate said. "Don't you realize I have power either to free you or to crucify you?" (John 19:10)

Now Jesus flares up, in holy anger, if you will. Pilate asks a previous question in v. 9 "Where do you come from?" he asked Jesus, but Jesus gave him no answer. But when Pilate says "Don't you realize I have the power…," Jesus speaks up boldly. "You would have no power over me if it were not given to you from above." What is he saying? YOU THINK YOU HAVE POWER OVER ME! NOBODY TAKES MY LIFE FROM ME I FREELY LAY IT DOWN. YOU THINK YOU'RE RUNNING THIS? YOU'RE NOT RUNNING THIS, I'M RUNNING THIS. YOU'RE IN CHARGE BUT YOU'RE NOT RUNNING ANYTHING, I'M RUNNING THIS. I'm orchestrating this; this is in my Father's divine will.

THIS IS THE GREAT ISSUE OF KINGDOM COMMUNICATOIN. Jesus is saying, I'm not talking about power, I'm talking about power. Everybody wants power, everybody wants a kingdom, this is not talking about power, and not about a kingdom, rather it's about a kingdom, and power.

Peter is struggling with this issue, "Lord are you going to give us the power? Jesus says, "I hear you and I hear your question, but I sense you're talking about power, I'm not talking about power, I'm talking about power. You're not going to receive the power that you are thinking about, that's all in God's time. But I will give you power!"

This whole issue over power comes to light in churches, marriages, vocations, etc…. Many church splits are over power struggles on the color of the carpet. They are so focused on the idea of power being the same as that of the disciples before they really understood what Jesus really meant by power. But the sad thing is when people use the language of the kingdom, for their own agenda.

When Old Granny Wilson says, "Thus saith the Lord that music is too loud" she her own opinion and comforts with the will of God. This is the classic use of spiritual language to end the argument. When one says "THUS SAITH THE LORD," how can anyone argue with that?

This type of thinking turns the Gifts of the Spirit into a Pentecostal Poker game. One says "I have a vision." The next one says "I see your vision, but I have 3 dreams, that's a FULL HOUSE. Understand it becomes a jockeying for power. It's really no different then when a 2 year old jerks her hand out of her mother's hand and runs across a busy street putting their life in danger. And because this jockeying for power spirit shows up in so many institutions, this sprit can affect, a country, a church, a marriage, a family or a life. Many Christians are saying "LORD WHEN DO I GET THE POWER." Let me give you a powerful illustration.

ILLUSTRATION

There was a 16 year old girl, about 1,000 miles from Beijing. She's beaten senseless, gang raped by hear guards, and has her fingernails torn out with a pair of pliers. And they throw into a prison cell and she presses her face against the bars, and says, "God loves you, I love you, and after what you've done to me today, you'll never be able to sleep tonight, so let me sing to you the songs of Zion." And she sings to her guards, until their hearts are melted to God. They have the guns, they have the uniforms, they have the keys, they have the power, and THEY ARE POWERLESS BEFORE HER. She has nothing, she has nothing, as a bankrupt prisoner of an oppressive prison, but she is in total control; she has the power in which Jesus spoke of.

In Acts 1:8 Jesus was saying I am giving you power to live, to die, and to live with integrity, as you are my faithful witnesses in a world that hates Me, yet that nevertheless need Me. I'm sending you into the world defenseless (physical power), as sheep among wolves, but I'm not going to let you be harmed. They may torture you and kill you, but I'm not going to let anything happen to you. You may die but you're not going to DIE. But, when the Holy Spirit comes on you, I'll give you power, more and greater then anything you'd ever imagine. The promise of the Kingdom is that he would baptize you with power, even the power to die for Him.

Application: Are you are feeling like you are always fighting for power, in every way except really walking surrendered, submitted, yielded, crucified and walking in the power of the Holy Spirit? Are you filled with the power of God, not to speak in tongues as the main focus, but rather to be a witness for Christ daily?

Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil <><

title.rendered: Communicating the Kingdom (Part 4) – Inspired by Mark Rutland

content.rendered:
Good Morning,

May you enjoy part 4 of Communicating the Kingdom.

"After his suffering, he showed himself to these men and gave many convincing proofs that he was alive. He appeared to them over a period of forty days and spoke about the kingdom of God." Acts 1:3

Now Thomas (called Didymus), one of the Twelve, was not with the disciples when Jesus came. So the other disciples told him, "We have seen the Lord!" But he said to them, "Unless I see the nail marks in his hands and put my finger where the nails were, and put my hand into his side, I will not believe it." (John 20:24-25)

They said, I can't take this anymore, He's king, He's not, He's alive, He's dead, He's a live again, He loves me, He loves me not, they said I can't do this anymore. Thomas even expresses it, he basically says "I can't live in this up and down way anymore; I will not believe this until I put my hand in His side, until I put my fingers through the nail scares. I can't live like this, He's the Messiah, He's not, He heals the sick, He raises the dead, He is dead, and then He's not dead. I just can't do this!" A week later, Jesus walks through the wall, and says "here touch that". Thomas says, "no Lord I don't need to do that now." Jesus says, no you said it, you're going to do it. This was the same Thomas that earlier said to Jesus and the disciples, "Let us also go, that we may die with him." (John 11:6) What a shift in language from Thomas, from dying to doubting.

Do you see this whole conversation, is an issue of miscommunication? They're thinking KINGDOM; the Davidic dynasty reestablished, with its geopolitical, socioeconomic, and religious center at Jerusalem. They see Jesus on the throne and themselves ruling and reigning with Him 1,000 yrs. What did Isaiah say, "you shall you the nations with a rod of iron," and they think the Romans ruled us with a rod of iron, now they feel it's their turn to rule the Romans with a rod of iron and they can't wait.

Now here's Jesus, He's alive again, and He spends the next 40 days talking to them about the kingdom of God. And the Disciples are probably thinking, "This is it, what a joker Jesus is, he really played a joke on the Romans. NOW COMES THE KINGDOM!" Jesus says, "Not many days from now you shall receive the promise of the Father. (Acts 1:4-5) Again they are thinking wrong, as they are hearing the promise of the Father as a physical power statement. So they ask, "Wilt thou at this time restore again the kingdom to Israel?" They are feeling "This is it, we are finally going to have a great new DAVID in a new JERUSALEM, and with a NEW THRONE, and a SWORD, and we'll rule and reign, and not Caesar, but KING JESUS. And I can picture Jesus looking intently at them and saying, "NO".

This whole issue is one of miscommunication. Remember when Jesus was UNDER ARREST BY PILATE. Pilate basically said "LOOK, I LIKE YOU, I DON'T WANT TO KILL YOU. ARE YOU A KING? THESE PEOPLE TELL ME YOU'RE CLAIMING TO BE A KING. ARE YOU A KING OR NOT." Jesus replies knowing that Pilate will not understand. In the vernacular Jesus responds "Yes, I am a king, but I'm not a king like Cesar a king, I'm a king. Cesar has an army, his army has, swords, I have an army my army has swords. But my army doesn't fight like his army fights, my army fights, and we're not going to conquer anything, we're going to be more then conquers." Can you imagine what is going through Pilate's mind? But ultimately Pilate does not want to kill Jesus.
